Title: Partner plank band row
Desc: The partner plank band row is an abdominal exercise where two partners perform single-arm planks while pulling on the opposite ends of an exercise band. This technique can be done for time or reps in any ab-focused workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position facing your partner, with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Each partner should hold one end of an exercise band with one hand. 3. Engage your core and maintain a straight line from head to heels. 4. While holding the plank, pull the band towards your side, using your free hand to stabilize. 5. Alternate sides for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Banded crunch isometric hold
Desc: The banded crunch isometric hold is an exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, particularly the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. The band adds resistance and continuous tension to this popular exercise.
HowTo: 1. Secure a resistance band around your feet or behind your head. 2. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 3. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, performing a crunch. 4. Hold the crunch position for the desired duration, maintaining tension in the band. 5. Lower back down with control and repeat.

Title: FYR Banded Plank Jack
Desc: The banded plank jack is a variation on the plank that involves moving the legs in and out for repetitions. Having a band around the thighs forces the lower body to work harder, particularly the hips and glutes. The plank jack is commonly performed as part of a bodyweight circuit, or as part of a dynamic warm-up.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with a resistance band around your thighs. 2. Engage your core and keep your body in a straight line. 3. Jump your feet out wide and then back together, maintaining the plank position. 4. Perform the jumping motion for the desired number of reps.

Title: Banded crunch
Desc: The banded crunch is an exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, particularly the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. The band adds resistance and continuous tension to this popular exercise.
HowTo: 1. Secure a resistance band around your feet or behind your head. 2. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 3. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, performing a crunch. 4. Focus on squeezing your abdominal muscles at the top of the movement. 5. Lower back down with control and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Crunch
Desc: The crunch is a popular core exercise targeting the rectus abdominis, or "six-pack" muscles, as well as the obliques. It has been the centerpiece of many ab-focused workouts, due to both its simplicity and the intense burn and mind-muscle connection it produces. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Place your hands behind your head or crossed over your chest. 3. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, curling your torso towards your knees. 4. Hold for a moment at the top, then lower back down with control. 5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Decline band press sit-up
Desc: The decline band press sit-up is a weighted core exercise that works the rectus abdominis or "six pack" muscles, as well as the deep core muscles. It also taxes the muscles of the shoulders and upper back. Sit-up variations with added resistance are usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of the core-focused portion of a workout.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Deep Core, Shoulders, Upper Back
HowTo: 1. Secure a resistance band behind your head and hold it with both hands. 2. Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured. 3. Engage your core and perform a sit-up by lifting your torso towards your knees. 4. As you sit up, press the band forward to add resistance. 5. Lower back down with control and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: FYR2 Banded Frog Pump
Desc: The FYR2 Banded Frog Pump is an exercise that targets the glutes and hamstrings. It involves lying on your back with your feet elevated and banded, performing a pumping motion to engage the lower body effectively.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your feet elevated and the resistance band secured around your thighs. 2. Engage your core and keep your feet together. 3. Perform a pumping motion by lifting your hips off the ground while squeezing your glutes. 4. Hold for a moment at the top, then lower back down. 5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Band low-to-high twist
Desc: The band low-to-high twist is a core exercise targeting the upper abdominals and the obliques. Take care to perform it with control, as rapid, uncontrolled twisting can injure the spine. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps, at least 8-15 per side, as part of the core-focused portion of a workout.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band with both hands. 2. Start with the band at your hips, then twist your torso to bring the band up and across your body to shoulder height. 3. Control the movement as you return to the starting position. 4. Alternate sides for the desired number of reps.

Title: Barbell roll-out
Desc: The barbell roll-out is an abdominal exercise that utilizes a barbell in the place of an ab roller. It is best performed with a barbell that has rotating collars, and is considered more difficult than other ab roller variations. Many lifters may not be able to perform a single rep at first, but once they can perform these for reps, they'll be rewarded with a seriously strong core.
HowTo: Kneel on the floor with the barbell in front of you. Grip the barbell with both hands, shoulder-width apart. Engage your core and slowly roll the barbell forward, extending your body while keeping your hips down. Roll out as far as you can while maintaining control, then pull the barbell back towards you to return to the starting position.

Title: Barbell Ab Rollout - On Knees
Desc: The barbell roll-out is an abdominal exercise that utilizes a barbell in the place of an ab roller. It is best performed with a barbell that has rotating collars, and is considered more difficult than other ab roller variations. Many lifters may not be able to perform a single rep at first, but once they can perform these for reps, they'll be rewarded with a seriously strong core.
HowTo: Kneel on the floor with the barbell in front of you. Grip the barbell with both hands, shoulder-width apart. Engage your core and slowly roll the barbell forward, extending your body while keeping your hips down. Roll out as far as you can while maintaining control, then pull the barbell back towards you to return to the starting position.

Title: Decline bar press sit-up
Desc: The decline bar press sit-up is a weighted core exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, particularly the lower abs. It also challenges the shoulders and upper back to move the weight. Weighted sit-up variations are usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of the core-focused portion of a workout.
HowTo: Lie on a decline bench with a barbell held above your chest. Engage your core and perform a sit-up by pressing the barbell upward while lifting your torso towards your knees. Lower back down with control to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Bench barbell roll-out
Desc: The bench barbell roll-out is a challenging exercise targeting the abdominals. It is similar to using an ab roller, but using a barbell allows for a wider grip. Placing the knees on a bench rather than the floor makes the move more difficult by increasing the challenge to the upper body.
HowTo: Kneel on a bench with a barbell in front of you. Grip the barbell with both hands, shoulder-width apart. Engage your core and slowly roll the barbell forward, extending your body while keeping your hips down. Roll out as far as you can while maintaining control, then pull the barbell back towards you to return to the starting position.

Title: Barbell Side Bend
Desc: The Barbell Side Bend is an effective exercise for targeting the oblique muscles. To perform this exercise, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart while holding a barbell across your shoulders. Slowly bend to one side, keeping your core engaged, and return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side. This exercise helps improve core strength and stability.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting across your shoulders. Engage your core and slowly bend to one side, keeping your back straight. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Perform for the desired number of reps.

Title: Seated bar twist
Desc: The seated bar twist is a core exercise meant to strengthen the obliques. It is often performed for high reps with relatively light weight, such as an empty barbell, a lightweight fixed-weight bar, or even a PVC pipe. It can be performed during a workout, at the end of a workout, or outside of the gym to build core strength and resiliency.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with your legs extended and hold a barbell with both hands. Twist your torso to one side, bringing the barbell across your body, then return to the center and twist to the other side. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Single-arm landmine pull and press
Desc: The single-arm landmine pull and press is an explosive rotational movement using a barbell anchored in a landmine device. It combines a pull off the floor with rotation and finishes with a press. It is usually performed for low reps per set with an emphasis on speed and form, not moving heavy weight.
HowTo: Stand with a barbell anchored in a landmine device. Grip the barbell with one hand and pull it towards your body while rotating your torso. Once the barbell is near your shoulder, press it overhead. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms.

Title: Barbell Ab Roll Out - Gethin Variation
Desc: The barbell roll-out is an abdominal exercise that utilizes a barbell in the place of an ab roller. It is best performed with a barbell that has rotating collars, and is considered more difficult than other ab roller variations. Many lifters may not be able to perform a single rep at first, but once they can perform these for reps, they'll be rewarded with a seriously strong core.
HowTo: Kneel on the floor with the barbell in front of you. Grip the barbell with both hands, shoulder-width apart. Engage your core and slowly roll the barbell forward, extending your body while keeping your hips down. Roll out as far as you can while maintaining control, then pull the barbell back towards you to return to the starting position.

Title: 30 Barbell Floor Wiper
Desc: The barbell floor wiper is a core exercise in which the barbell is held in the locked-out position of a floor press, and the hips and legs are rotated side to side. It targets the oblique muscles of the lateral abdomen, but is also seriously challenging to the deep core and rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with a barbell held in the locked-out position above your chest. 2. Engage your core and rotate your hips and legs to one side, lowering them towards the floor. 3. Return to the center and then rotate to the opposite side. 4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: 30 Barbell Roll-Out
Desc: The barbell roll-out is an abdominal exercise that utilizes a barbell in the place of an ab roller. It is best performed with a barbell that has rotating collars, and is considered more difficult than other ab roller variations. Many lifters may not be able to perform a single rep at first, but once they can perform these for reps, they'll be rewarded with a seriously strong core.
HowTo: 1. Start in a kneeling position with a barbell in front of you. 2. Grip the barbell with both hands, shoulder-width apart. 3. Roll the barbell forward, extending your body while keeping your core tight. 4. Roll out as far as you can without losing form, then pull the barbell back towards you to return to the starting position. 5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Decline plate sit-up
Desc: The decline plate sit-up is a weighted core exercise that works the rectus abdominis or "six pack" muscles, as well as the deep core muscles. Weighted sit-up variations are usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of the core-focused portion of a workout.
HowTo: 1. Set up on a decline bench with a weight plate held against your chest. 2. Lie back and engage your core. 3. Perform a sit-up by curling your torso towards your knees, lifting your upper body off the bench. 4. Lower back down with control. 5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: KV Barbell Hip Thrust
Desc: The KV Barbell Hip Thrust is an effective exercise for targeting the glutes and hamstrings. To perform this exercise, sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench, roll a barbell over your hips, and thrust your hips upward while keeping your feet flat on the ground.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and your feet flat on the floor. 2. Roll a barbell over your hips. 3. Drive through your heels and thrust your hips upward, squeezing your glutes at the top. 4. Lower your hips back down to the ground. 5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Advanced Kettlebell Windmill
Desc: The Advanced Kettlebell Windmill is a complex movement that enhances core stability and shoulder mobility. Begin by holding a kettlebell overhead with one arm, then hinge at the hips and lower your torso towards the ground while keeping your eyes on the kettlebell, and return to the starting position.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a kettlebell overhead with one arm. 2. Hinge at your hips and lower your torso towards the ground while keeping your eyes on the kettlebell. 3. Return to the starting position by engaging your core and driving through your legs. 4. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Kettlebell Windmill
Desc: The single-kettlebell windmill is a dynamic kettlebell exercise emphasizing core strength and shoulder and hip mobility and stability. It is often used as a functional warm-up or for multi-directional strength work. It doesn't work as well in a metcon or conditioning setting, and shouldn't be performed under intense fatigue.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand. 2. Hinge at your hips and lower your torso towards the ground while keeping the kettlebell close to your body. 3. Rotate your torso and reach down to touch the kettlebell with your free hand. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Kettlebell Pass Between The Legs
Desc: The Kettlebell Pass Between The Legs is a dynamic exercise that improves grip strength and coordination. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, swing the kettlebell between your legs, and then pass it to the opposite hand while maintaining a strong core and proper posture.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand. 2. Swing the kettlebell between your legs, keeping your back straight and core engaged. 3. As the kettlebell swings forward, pass it to your opposite hand. 4. Continue swinging and passing the kettlebell between your legs for the desired number of reps.

Title: Kettlebell 3-point leg extension
Desc: The kettlebell 3-point leg extension is a dynamic core exercise performed around and over a kettlebell or other short, stationary object. It is similar in some ways to a V-up or reverse crunch, but targets both the obliques and the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles. It can be performed for reps or for time, usually in dedicated ab training or as part of a kettlebell and bodyweight circuit workout.
HowTo: 1. Start by lying on your back with a kettlebell placed between your legs. 2. Engage your core and lift your legs to bring the kettlebell towards your torso. 3. Extend your legs out to the side while keeping your core tight. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Double Kettlebell Swing
Desc: The Double Kettlebell Swing is a dynamic exercise that targets the posterior chain, including the glutes, hamstrings, and lower back. It involves swinging two kettlebells simultaneously from between the legs to shoulder height, emphasizing hip hinge and explosive power.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand. Hinge at the hips and lower the kettlebells between your legs. Engage your core and explosively drive your hips forward to swing the kettlebells up to shoulder height. Keep your arms straight and allow the kettlebells to swing back down between your legs as you hinge again.

Title: Burpee over kettlebell
Desc: The burpee over kettlebell is a more advanced version of a popular conditioning exercise. If you're performing a circuit that already has both burpees and kettlebell movements, it's a simple way to provide a novel stimulus to the muscles of the lower body and create a more athletic style of training.
HowTo: Start in a standing position with a kettlebell on the ground in front of you. Perform a burpee by squatting down, placing your hands on the ground, and jumping your feet back into a plank position. Perform a push-up if desired, then jump your feet back towards your hands. Stand up and jump over the kettlebell, landing softly on the other side.

Title: Kettlebell toe-touch
Desc: The kettlebell toe-touch is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement usually done for high reps. The simple addition of a weight makes the toe-touch far more difficult, providing a different stimulus to the core during training.
HowTo: Lie on your back with a kettlebell in one hand. Lift your legs straight up towards the ceiling. Engage your core and reach the kettlebell towards your toes, lifting your shoulders off the ground. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of repetitions, switching sides if needed.

Title: Kettlebell swing
Desc: The kettlebell swing is a popular lower-body exercise emphasizing the hamstrings, glutes, and back muscles. It is often used to train explosive power, for aerobic or cardiovascular conditioning, in circuit training, or as an accessory movement for the deadlift.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell with both hands in front of you. Hinge at the hips and lower the kettlebell between your legs. Engage your core and explosively thrust your hips forward to swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height, keeping your arms straight. Allow the kettlebell to swing back down between your legs and repeat.

Title: Two-way swing
Desc: The two-way kettlebell swing is an exercise that alternates a chest-height kettlebell swing (sometimes called a "Russian" or "hardstyle" swing) with an overhead kettlebell swing (sometimes called an "American" swing). Both swing variations work many of the same muscles, such as the hamstrings, glutes, and core, but because the weight must travel farther in the overhead swing, it's slightly more metabolically demanding and works the upper back and shoulders more. This combo can be performed for time or reps and works especially well in circuit-style or full-body training. If you can't perform the overhead swing without lower back or shoulder pain, just perform the chest-height swing.
Muscles: Hamstrings, Glutes, Core, Upper Back, Shoulders
HowTo: Start with a kettlebell in both hands at chest height. Perform a Russian swing by hinging at the hips and swinging the kettlebell to chest height. Then, transition to an American swing by swinging the kettlebell overhead. Alternate between these two swings for the desired number of repetitions or time.

Title: Kettlebell crab reach
Desc: The kettlebell crab reach is a kettlebell pressing exercise in which the lifter presses a kettlebell overhead while in a modified single-arm bridge position. The simple addition of a weight makes the reach far more difficult, challenging the muscles of the back, shoulders, glutes, and core.
HowTo: Begin in a modified single-arm bridge position with one arm on the ground and the opposite arm holding a kettlebell overhead. Press the kettlebell up while maintaining stability in your hips and core. Lower the kettlebell back down and repeat, ensuring to engage your back, shoulders, and glutes throughout the movement.

Title: Taylor Single-Arm Kettlebell Swing
Desc: The Taylor Single-Arm Kettlebell Swing is a variation of the traditional kettlebell swing that focuses on unilateral strength and stability. It involves swinging a single kettlebell with one arm while maintaining core engagement and proper hip movement.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand. Hinge at the hips and lower the kettlebell between your legs. Engage your core and swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height using one arm. Keep your movements controlled and focus on maintaining balance and stability throughout the swing.

Title: Holman Kettlebell Up to Elbow Down
Desc: The Holman Kettlebell Up to Elbow Down is an exercise that combines a kettlebell swing with a controlled lowering phase. It emphasizes shoulder stability and core strength as the kettlebell is brought up to the elbow and then lowered back down.
HowTo: Start in a standing position with a kettlebell in one hand. Perform a kettlebell swing, bringing the kettlebell up to shoulder height. As you lower the kettlebell, control the descent and bring it down to your elbow while maintaining a stable core. Repeat the swing and controlled lowering for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: FYR2 Double-Kettlebell Ski
Desc: The FYR2 Double-Kettlebell Ski is a dynamic exercise that combines the benefits of kettlebell training with a skiing motion, engaging the legs, core, and shoulders for a full-body workout.
HowTo: 1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand. 2. Engage your core and hinge at the hips, lowering your body into a ski position. 3. As you lower, keep your back straight and your chest up. 4. Push through your heels to return to standing, mimicking a skiing motion. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: FYR2 Kettlebell Hike
Desc: The FYR2 Kettlebell Hike is an explosive movement that mimics the hiking motion, focusing on the posterior chain, grip strength, and overall power development.
HowTo: 1. Begin standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand. 2. Hike the kettlebell back between your legs, keeping your back flat. 3. Explode upward, swinging the kettlebell forward and up. 4. Catch the kettlebell at shoulder height, engaging your core. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, alternating hands if desired.

Title: FYR2 Kettlebell Cross-Body Catch
Desc: The FYR2 Kettlebell Cross-Body Catch is a coordination and agility exercise that involves catching a kettlebell across the body, enhancing hand-eye coordination and core stability.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position, holding a kettlebell in one hand. 2. Swing the kettlebell across your body to the opposite side. 3. As the kettlebell approaches, prepare to catch it with the opposite hand. 4. Focus on timing and coordination as you catch the kettlebell. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, alternating sides.

Title: FYR2 Kettlebell Duck Walk
Desc: The FYR2 Kettlebell Duck Walk is a unique lower body exercise that combines squatting and walking, targeting the quads, glutes, and improving mobility.
HowTo: 1. Hold a kettlebell in each hand and squat down into a low position. 2. Keep your back straight and your chest up as you walk forward in this squatted position. 3. Take small, controlled steps while maintaining the squat. 4. Walk for a set distance or number of steps. 5. Stand up to finish the exercise.

Title: FYR2 Kettlebell Get-Up Reach
Desc: The FYR2 Kettlebell Get-Up Reach is a progression of the Turkish get-up, focusing on stability and strength as you transition from lying down to standing while reaching overhead.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with a kettlebell in one hand, arm extended overhead. 2. Bend the knee on the same side and place your foot flat on the ground. 3. Use your free hand to push yourself up onto your elbow, then your hand. 4. Lift your hips off the ground and transition to a kneeling position. 5. Stand up while keeping the kettlebell overhead. 6. Reverse the movement to return to the starting position.

Title: FYR2 Kettlebell Juggle
Desc: The FYR2 Kettlebell Juggle is a fun and challenging exercise that involves tossing and catching kettlebells, improving coordination, timing, and grip strength.
HowTo: 1. Start by holding a kettlebell in one hand at shoulder height. 2. Toss the kettlebell slightly into the air, using a light upward motion. 3. As the kettlebell rises, prepare to catch it with the same hand or switch hands. 4. Focus on timing and hand-eye coordination as you catch the kettlebell. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: FYR2 Squat-Clean-Alternating-Press Complex
Desc: The FYR2 Squat-Clean-Alternating-Press Complex is a comprehensive strength and conditioning drill that combines squats, cleans, and presses for a full-body workout.
HowTo: 1. Begin standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand. 2. Perform a squat, lowering your body while keeping the kettlebells at your sides. 3. As you rise from the squat, clean the kettlebells to shoulder height. 4. Press the kettlebells overhead, alternating arms with each repetition. 5. Repeat the sequence for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Dumbbell V-Sit Cross Jab
Desc: The dumbbell V-sit cross jab is a hybrid movement that trains the abdominal and shoulder muscles simultaneously. It can address multiple muscle groups in a time-efficient muscle-building or circuit-style workout, while also providing a cardiovascular challenge.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the floor with your legs in a V position, holding a dumbbell in each hand. 2. Engage your core and lean back slightly. 3. Rotate your torso to one side and jab the dumbbell across your body. 4. Return to the center and repeat on the other side. 5. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Dumbbell spell caster
Desc: The dumbbell spell caster is an exercise that primarily targets the abdominal muscles such as the obliques. However, it also works shoulders, back, hips, and legs, and demands all of those muscles work together in a coordinated motion. It is usually performed with relatively light weights for moderate to high reps, at least 8-12 reps per side. Make sure to only use a weight you can control.
Muscles: Abdominals, Obliques, Shoulders, Back, Hips, Legs
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Engage your core and lean to one side, lowering the dumbbell towards your knee. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Perform 8-12 reps per side.

Title: Dumbbell side bend
Desc: The dumbbell side bend is a popular exercise for targeting the oblique muscles of the abdomen. It is usually performed for relatively high reps, at least 8-12 reps per set or more. It can be performed one side at a time or alternating sides.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand. Slowly bend to the side, bringing the dumbbell down towards your knee. Return to the starting position and repeat for 8-12 reps before switching sides.

Title: Dumbbell crunch
Desc: The dumbbell crunch is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement. The simple addition of a weight makes the crunch far more difficult, providing a different stimulus to the core during training.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and hold a dumbbell against your chest. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, crunching towards your knees. Lower back down and repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Sprawl
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Sprawl is a dynamic exercise that combines a sprawl with a dumbbell movement, targeting the core, shoulders, and legs. Start in a standing position, drop into a sprawl while holding a dumbbell, then return to standing and press the dumbbell overhead.
HowTo: Start in a standing position holding a dumbbell in both hands. Drop into a sprawl by lowering your body to the ground, then push back up to standing while pressing the dumbbell overhead. Repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Alternating Renegade Row
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Alternating Renegade Row is a strength exercise that engages the back, arms, and core. Begin in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Row one dumbbell towards your hip while stabilizing your body with the other arm, then alternate sides.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Row one dumbbell towards your hip while keeping your body stable, then lower it back down. Alternate sides for 8-12 reps per side.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Mountain Climber
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Mountain Climber is a high-intensity exercise that works the core, shoulders, and legs. Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Quickly alternate bringing your knees towards your chest while maintaining a strong plank.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Quickly alternate bringing your knees towards your chest while maintaining a strong plank position. Continue for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Russian Twist
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Russian Twist is an effective core exercise that targets the obliques. Sit on the floor with your knees bent, lean back slightly, and hold a dumbbell with both hands. Rotate your torso to one side, then the other, while keeping your core engaged.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and hold a dumbbell with both hands. Lean back slightly and rotate your torso to the right, bringing the dumbbell beside your hip. Return to the center and rotate to the left. Repeat for 8-12 reps per side.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Pull-Over
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Pull-Over is a compound exercise that works the chest, back, and triceps. Lie on a bench with a dumbbell held above your chest. Slowly lower the dumbbell back over your head, then pull it back to the starting position.
HowTo: Lie on a bench with a dumbbell held above your chest. Slowly lower the dumbbell back over your head in a controlled manner, then pull it back to the starting position above your chest. Repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Sit-Up
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Sit-Up is an effective core exercise that targets the abdominal muscles. To perform this exercise, lie on your back with your knees bent and hold a dumbbell against your chest. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, then lower back down with control.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and hold a dumbbell against your chest. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, then lower back down with control.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Front Squat
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Dumbbell Front Squat is a lower body exercise that emphasizes the quadriceps, glutes, and core stability. To execute this movement, hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with your elbows pointing forward. Squat down by bending your knees and hips while keeping your chest up, then push through your heels to return to standing.
HowTo: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with your elbows pointing forward. Squat down by bending your knees and hips while keeping your chest up, then push through your heels to return to standing.

Title: Dumbbell Fix Full Man Maker
Desc: The Dumbbell Fix Full Man Maker is a full-body workout that combines a push-up, a row, and a squat with a press. Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Perform a push-up, then row one dumbbell to your side, followed by the other. Jump your feet forward to a squat position and press the dumbbells overhead as you stand up.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Obliques, Shoulders, Chest, Triceps
HowTo: Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Perform a push-up, then row one dumbbell to your side, followed by the other. Jump your feet forward to a squat position and press the dumbbells overhead as you stand up.

Title: Dumbbell T-hold
Desc: The dumbbell T-hold is a static exercise that primarily targets the obliques, although it also works the shoulders and upper back. It involves holding a dumbbell in the air while in a side plank position. It is usually performed for timed holds, although it can be performed dynamically for reps as a plank with dumbbell rotation.
HowTo: Hold a dumbbell in the air while in a side plank position. You can perform this exercise for timed holds or dynamically for reps with dumbbell rotation.

Title: Dumbbell hollow-body floor press
Desc: The dumbbell hollow-body floor press combines upper-body strength and core work in one move.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest. Engage your core and press the dumbbells upward while maintaining a hollow-body position.

Title: Dumbbell crusher
Desc: The dumbbell crusher is a dumbbell complex that combines a squat with a dumbbell curl, followed by a triceps press. It targets the legs, glutes, biceps, shoulders, and triceps in a single sequence, making it a great way to burn serious calories and hit a lot of muscles in a short period of time. The upper-body movements will determine the amount of weight you can effectively use.
Muscles: Quadriceps, Glutes, Biceps, Shoulders, Triceps, Core
HowTo: Start by holding a dumbbell in each hand. Perform a squat, then as you rise, curl the dumbbells to your shoulders. Finally, press the dumbbells overhead to complete the movement.

Title: Dumbbell Crunch - Gethin Variation
Desc: The dumbbell crunch is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement. The simple addition of a weight makes the crunch far more difficult, providing a different stimulus to the core during training.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and hold a dumbbell above your chest. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, then lower back down with control.

Title: Single-arm dumbbell crunch
Desc: The single-arm dumbbell crunch is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement. Adding a weight to one side makes the crunch far more difficult to your rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, as well as the obliques and deep core muscles.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Obliques, Deep Core Muscles
HowTo: Lie on your back with one dumbbell held in one hand above your chest. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards the side of the dumbbell, then lower back down with control.

Title: HM Alternating Dumbbell Plank Row
Desc: The HM Alternating Dumbbell Plank Row is a core and upper body exercise that combines a plank position with a rowing motion using dumbbells. Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. While maintaining a stable core, row one dumbbell towards your hip while balancing on the other arm. Alternate sides for a complete set.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. 2. Maintain a stable core throughout the exercise. 3. Row one dumbbell towards your hip while balancing on the other arm. 4. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position. 5. Alternate sides for a complete set.

Title: Dumbbell straight-legged hip raise
Desc: The dumbbell straight-legged hip raise works the hips and glutes. It requires and teaches body control and coordination.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back with your legs straight and a dumbbell held between your feet. 2. Raise your hips towards the ceiling while keeping your legs straight. 3. Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement. 4. Lower your hips back down to the starting position.

Title: Seated leg tuck with dumbbell
Desc: The seated leg tuck with dumbbell is an ab exercise requiring only a bench and a dumbbell. It's commonly performed for high reps as a burnout at the end of a core workout.
HowTo: 1. Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand. 2. Lean back slightly and lift your legs off the ground, tucking your knees towards your chest. 3. Extend your legs back out without touching the ground. 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Dumbbell V-sit cross jab-
Desc: The dumbbell V-sit cross jab is a hybrid movement that trains the abdominal and shoulder muscles simultaneously. It can address multiple muscle groups in a time-efficient muscle-building or circuit-style workout, while also providing a cardiovascular challenge.
HowTo: 1. Sit in a V-sit position with your legs raised and bent at the knees. 2. Hold a dumbbell in one hand. 3. Rotate your torso to the side and extend the dumbbell across your body in a jab motion. 4. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: 30 Hanging Leg Raise With Dumbbell
Desc: The 30 Hanging Leg Raise With Dumbbell is an advanced core exercise that targets the abdominal muscles. Hang from a pull-up bar with a dumbbell held between your feet. Raise your legs to a 90-degree angle while keeping your core engaged, then lower them back down slowly. Aim for 30 repetitions.
HowTo: 1. Hang from a pull-up bar with a dumbbell held securely between your feet. 2. Engage your core and raise your legs to a 90-degree angle. 3. Hold for a moment at the top, then lower your legs back down slowly. 4. Aim for 30 repetitions.

Title: Dumbbell Get-Up Sit-Up
Desc: The Dumbbell Get-Up Sit-Up is a full-body exercise that enhances core strength and stability. Start lying on your back holding a dumbbell with both hands above your chest. Perform a sit-up while keeping the dumbbell extended, then return to the starting position. This exercise engages multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: 1. Lie on your back holding a dumbbell with both hands above your chest. 2. Engage your core and perform a sit-up while keeping the dumbbell extended above you. 3. Return to the starting position with control. 4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Right Side Plank with Left Triceps Press
Desc: The Holman Right Side Plank with Left Triceps Press is a variation of the side plank that targets the obliques and triceps. Begin in a right side plank position with your right elbow on the ground. Hold a dumbbell in your left hand and press it overhead while maintaining balance. Lower the dumbbell back to your shoulder and repeat.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a right side plank position with your right elbow on the ground. 2. Hold a dumbbell in your left hand. 3. Press the dumbbell overhead while maintaining balance in the side plank. 4. Lower the dumbbell back to your shoulder. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Left Side Plank with Right Triceps Press
Desc: The Holman Left Side Plank with Right Triceps Press is similar to the right side variation, focusing on the left side. Start in a left side plank position with your left elbow on the ground. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand and press it overhead while keeping your body straight. Lower the dumbbell back to your shoulder and repeat.
HowTo: 1. Start in a left side plank position with your left elbow on the ground. 2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand. 3. Press the dumbbell overhead while keeping your body straight. 4. Lower the dumbbell back to your shoulder. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Boat with Feet Push-Out and Overhead Press
Desc: The Holman Boat with Feet Push-Out and Overhead Press is a dynamic core exercise that combines a boat pose with a push-out of the feet and an overhead press using dumbbells. This exercise targets the abdominal muscles, shoulders, and improves overall stability.
HowTo: Begin in a boat pose with your legs lifted and bent at the knees. Hold a dumbbell in each hand. Push your feet out while maintaining the boat position, then press the dumbbells overhead. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Holman Hovering Plank Row
Desc: The Holman Hovering Plank Row is an advanced core and upper body exercise that involves holding a plank position while performing a rowing motion with dumbbells. This exercise engages the core, back, and arms, enhancing stability and strength.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your body straight and a dumbbell in each hand. While maintaining the plank, row one dumbbell towards your waist, keeping your elbow close to your body. Alternate sides while keeping your core engaged.

Title: Holman Weighted Seated Killer Abs to Russian Twist
Desc: The Holman Weighted Seated Killer Abs to Russian Twist is a challenging core workout that combines seated ab exercises with Russian twists while holding a weight. This exercise targets the obliques and overall core strength.
HowTo: Sit on the ground with your knees bent and hold a weight. Lean back slightly and perform a Russian twist by rotating your torso to one side, then the other, while keeping your feet elevated. Engage your core throughout the movement.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Dumbbell Reach-Under
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Dumbbell Reach-Under is a core stability exercise that involves holding a straight plank position while reaching under the body with a dumbbell. This movement challenges the core and improves balance.
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position with a dumbbell in one hand. Reach under your body with the dumbbell, rotating your torso slightly, then return to the plank position. Alternate sides while maintaining a strong core.

Title: Holman Straight-Arm Side Plank Overhead Press to Chest Press
Desc: The Holman Straight-Arm Side Plank Overhead Press to Chest Press combines a side plank position with an overhead press and chest press using dumbbells. This exercise targets the shoulders, chest, and core.
HowTo: Start in a side plank position with one arm extended overhead holding a dumbbell. Perform an overhead press, then lower the dumbbell to your chest and perform a chest press. Alternate sides after completing the set.

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to Pike
Desc: The Holman Weighted Burpee to Pike is a high-intensity exercise that combines a burpee with a pike position, incorporating weights. This full-body workout enhances cardiovascular fitness and strength.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a weight. Squat down into a burpee position, kick your feet back into a plank, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back to your hands and explosively jump into a pike position, raising the weights overhead.

Title: Holman Straight-Legged Boat Chest Press
Desc: The Holman Straight-Legged Boat Chest Press is a core and upper body exercise that involves holding a straight-legged boat position while performing a chest press with dumbbells. This targets the chest and engages the core.
HowTo: Sit in a straight-legged boat position with your legs extended and hold a dumbbell in each hand. Perform a chest press by pushing the dumbbells away from your chest while maintaining the boat position. Engage your core throughout the exercise.

Title: Holman Weighted Burpee to Side Delt Raise
Desc: The Holman Weighted Burpee to Side Delt Raise is a dynamic exercise that combines a burpee with a side lateral raise using weights. This exercise works the entire body while focusing on shoulder strength.
HowTo: Start in a standing position holding weights. Perform a burpee by squatting down, kicking your feet back, and doing a push-up. Jump your feet back to your hands and, as you stand, perform a side lateral raise with the weights.

Title: Holman Heavy Double Pike
Desc: The Holman Heavy Double Pike is an advanced gymnastics exercise that involves performing a pike position while executing a double somersault in the air, emphasizing core strength and body control.
HowTo: To perform the Holman Heavy Double Pike, start by gaining momentum from a strong takeoff. As you jump, tuck your knees into a pike position while initiating a double somersault. Focus on maintaining core strength and body control throughout the rotation, and prepare for a controlled landing.

Title: Holman Heavy Double Split Pike
Desc: The Holman Heavy Double Split Pike is a challenging gymnastics move where the athlete performs a double somersault while splitting their legs in a pike position, requiring significant flexibility and strength.
HowTo: To execute the Holman Heavy Double Split Pike, begin with a powerful jump to gain height. As you ascend, split your legs into a pike position while performing a double somersault. Ensure you engage your core and maintain flexibility to achieve the split, landing safely and with control.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Dumbbell Sit-Through
Desc: The MetaBurn Alternating Dumbbell Sit-Through is a dynamic core exercise that combines a sit-up with a rotational movement, using dumbbells to enhance resistance and engage the obliques.
HowTo: To perform the MetaBurn Alternating Dumbbell Sit-Through, start by lying on your back with your knees bent and holding a dumbbell. As you sit up, twist your torso to one side, bringing the dumbbell across your body, then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side, alternating sides with each repetition.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Plank Row With Dumbbell Pull-Through
Desc: The MetaBurn Alternating Plank Row With Dumbbell Pull-Through is a full-body exercise that targets the core, back, and shoulders, involving a plank position while alternating rows with dumbbells and pulling a weight through.
HowTo: To do the MetaBurn Alternating Plank Row With Dumbbell Pull-Through, begin in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Perform a row by pulling one dumbbell towards your waist while stabilizing your body with the other arm. After completing the row, pull the opposite dumbbell through to the other side, alternating between arms.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Plank Row With Push-Up
Desc: The MetaBurn Alternating Plank Row With Push-Up is a compound exercise that combines a push-up with an alternating dumbbell row, engaging multiple muscle groups and enhancing upper body strength.
HowTo: To perform the MetaBurn Alternating Plank Row With Push-Up, start in a plank position. Execute a push-up, then shift your weight to one side and perform a row with the opposite arm. Return to the plank position and repeat, alternating sides with each row after each push-up.

Title: MetaBurn Dumbbell Russian Twist
Desc: The MetaBurn Dumbbell Russian Twist is a core-strengthening exercise that involves sitting on the ground with knees bent, twisting the torso side to side while holding a dumbbell, targeting the obliques.
HowTo: To do the MetaBurn Dumbbell Russian Twist, sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, lean back slightly, and twist your torso to the right, then to the left, engaging your obliques with each twist.

Title: MetaBurn Dumbbell Toe-Touch
Desc: The MetaBurn Dumbbell Toe-Touch is a flexibility and core exercise where the individual stands and bends forward to touch their toes while holding a dumbbell, promoting hamstring flexibility and core stability.
HowTo: To perform the MetaBurn Dumbbell Toe-Touch, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in both hands. Bend at the hips and lower your torso towards your toes, reaching the dumbbell down while keeping your knees slightly bent. Return to standing, engaging your core throughout the movement.

Title: MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Row
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Row is a stability exercise that combines a plank position with an alternating row motion using dumbbells, focusing on core stability and upper body strength.
HowTo: To execute the MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Row, start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. While maintaining a stable core, row one dumbbell towards your waist, then lower it back down and switch to the other side, alternating rows while keeping your body aligned.

Title: Standing dumbbell knee crunch-
Desc: The standing dumbbell knee crunch is a great way to train the abs while standing up. Additionally, the deltoids are worked because the lifter holds a pair of dumbbells overhead throughout.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand overhead. Engage your core and lift one knee towards your chest while bringing the dumbbells down to shoulder level. Lower your leg back down and repeat on the other side.

Title: MetaBurn Plank With Dumbbell Rotation
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank With Dumbbell Rotation is an exercise that combines a plank position with a rotational movement using a dumbbell. This exercise targets the core, shoulders, and improves stability and strength. Start in a plank position, holding a dumbbell in one hand, and rotate your torso to bring the dumbbell towards the ceiling while maintaining a stable plank.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in one hand. Engage your core and rotate your torso, lifting the dumbbell towards the ceiling while keeping your body stable. Return to the plank position and repeat on the other side.

Title: FYR2 Dumbbell Crab Reach
Desc: The FYR2 Dumbbell Crab Reach is a dynamic exercise that engages the core, shoulders, and hips. Begin in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground, lift one arm and the opposite leg while reaching towards the ceiling, then return to the starting position. This movement enhances mobility and coordination.
HowTo: Begin in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. Lift one arm and the opposite leg while reaching towards the ceiling. Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: FYR2 Dumbbell Man-Maker
Desc: The FYR2 Dumbbell Man-Maker is a full-body exercise that combines a push-up, a row, and a squat with a dumbbell. Start in a plank position, perform a push-up, then row a dumbbell to your side, jump your feet forward into a squat, and finish with an overhead press. This exercise builds strength and endurance.
HowTo: Start in a plank position. Perform a push-up, then row a dumbbell to your side. Jump your feet forward into a squat position, then press the dumbbell overhead as you stand up. Repeat the sequence.

Title: FYR2 Dumbbell Sit-Up Reach
Desc: The FYR2 Dumbbell Sit-Up Reach is a core exercise that combines a sit-up with an overhead reach using a dumbbell. Lie on your back with a dumbbell held above your chest, perform a sit-up while reaching the dumbbell towards the ceiling, and then lower back down. This movement strengthens the abdominal muscles.
HowTo: Lie on your back with a dumbbell held above your chest. Engage your core and perform a sit-up while reaching the dumbbell towards the ceiling. Lower back down to the starting position and repeat.

Title: FYR2 Loaded Beast Sprawl
Desc: The FYR2 Loaded Beast Sprawl is an advanced movement that combines a beast position with a sprawl. Start in a beast position on all fours, then jump your feet back into a plank and return to the beast position. This exercise enhances core stability and overall body control.
HowTo: Start in a beast position on all fours. Jump your feet back into a plank position, then jump them back to return to the beast position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: FYR2 Loaded to Unloaded Beast
Desc: The FYR2 Loaded to Unloaded Beast is a transition exercise that focuses on moving between loaded and unloaded positions. Begin in a loaded beast position with your knees off the ground, then shift to an unloaded position by lowering your knees while maintaining core engagement. This movement improves strength and mobility.
HowTo: Begin in a loaded beast position with your knees off the ground. Engage your core and lower your knees to the ground to transition into an unloaded position. Maintain core engagement throughout the movement.

Title: Lying Leg Pullover
Desc: The Lying Leg Pullover is an exercise that targets the core and upper body. Lie on your back with a dumbbell held above your chest, lower the dumbbell behind your head while keeping your arms straight, then pull it back to the starting position using your core. This exercise enhances flexibility and strength in the upper body.
HowTo: Lie on your back with a dumbbell held above your chest. Lower the dumbbell behind your head while keeping your arms straight. Engage your core to pull the dumbbell back to the starting position.

Title: Landmine twist
Desc: The landmine twist is a rotational abdominal movement performed using an angled barbell anchored at floor level in a landmine device. It can also be performed by sticking a barbell in the corner of a room, preferably in a towel to protect the walls. It targets the deep muscles of the core, including both the obliques and the transversus abdominis. It can be done fast or slow, for time or reps, either in traditional muscle-focused rep ranges such as 8-12 reps per side or for higher rep ranges.
HowTo: To perform the landmine twist, anchor a barbell in a landmine device or in the corner of a room. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the barbell with both hands at chest level. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing the barbell beside your hip, then return to the center and rotate to the left. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Suspended ab fall-out
Desc: The suspended ab fall-out is a dynamic abdominal exercise utilizing a suspension strap system or gymnastic rings. It is similar in form to an ab roller, but can more easily be scaled to be more or less difficult. It targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, as well as the deep core muscles. It can be trained for low reps for strength or higher reps for muscle definition.
HowTo: To perform the suspended ab fall-out, attach suspension straps or gymnastic rings to a stable anchor. Start in a kneeling position, holding the straps with both hands. Lean forward, extending your arms and allowing your body to fall forward while keeping your core engaged. Pull yourself back to the starting position using your abdominal muscles. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Decline reverse crunch
Desc: The decline reverse crunch is a popular bodyweight exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, particularly the lower abs. It is usually performed for high reps, such as 10-15 reps per set or more, as part of the ab-focused portion of a workout.
HowTo: To perform the decline reverse crunch, lie on a decline bench with your head lower than your feet. Grip the bench for stability and lift your legs, keeping your knees bent at a 90-degree angle. Engage your core to lift your hips off the bench, curling your knees towards your chest. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Plate Twist
Desc: The Plate Twist is an exercise that targets the core muscles, particularly the obliques. To perform this exercise, sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Hold a weight plate with both hands in front of you, and lean back slightly. Twist your torso to the right, bringing the plate beside your hip, then return to the center and twist to the left. This movement engages your abdominal muscles and improves rotational strength.
HowTo: To perform the Plate Twist, sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Hold a weight plate with both hands in front of you. Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight. Twist your torso to the right, bringing the plate beside your hip, then return to the center and twist to the left. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Weighted Crunches
Desc: The weighted suitcase crunch is a weighted version of a popular abdominal training exercise. The simple addition of a weight makes the suitcase crunch far more difficult, helping build the "six pack" muscles and providing a different stimulus to the core during training.
HowTo: To perform weighted crunches, lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, curling your torso towards your knees. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Ab Roller
Desc: The ab wheel roll-out is an exercise targeting the abdominals, often with an inexpensive wheel device with a handle on either side. Many trainers and strength coaches claim it's one of, if no the best exercise for developing strength in the midsection. Beginners may have to start with a limited range of motion or just wheel planks.
HowTo: To perform the ab roller, kneel on the floor and grasp the handles of the ab wheel. Start with the wheel close to your knees. Engage your core and roll the wheel forward, extending your body while keeping your back straight. Roll out as far as you can while maintaining control, then pull the wheel back towards your knees to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Otis-Up
Desc: The Otis-up is a weighted exercise focusing on the abdominal muscles, as well as the shoulders to a lesser degree. It primarily targets the rectus abdominus or “six-pack” muscles, but also involves the obliques and deep core muscles. It is normally performed on a decline bench holding a weight plate, but can also be performed with a dumbbell, kettlebell, or other weight.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Obliques, Deep Core Muscles
HowTo: To perform the Otis-up, lie on a decline bench holding a weight plate against your chest. Start with your body in a straight line from head to toe. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, using your abdominal muscles. Lower back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Captain's chair knee raise
Desc: The captain's chair knee raise is a bodyweight exercise that targets the abs. It is performed on an apparatus that allows the forearms to rest on pads and the upright torso to hang freely. Knee raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training.
HowTo: To perform the captain's chair knee raise, position yourself on the captain's chair apparatus with your forearms resting on the pads and your back against the support. Allow your legs to hang freely. Engage your core and raise your knees towards your chest, then lower them back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Sledgehammer swing
Desc: The sledgehammer swing is an exercise working the abdominals and numerous other muscles. The sledgehammer is slammed from overhead onto a tire which absorbs the impact and causes the hammer to bounce back up. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a functional fitness or athleticism-focused workout.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a sledgehammer with both hands. Raise the sledgehammer overhead, then swing it down forcefully onto a tire. Allow the hammer to bounce back up and repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Decline bar press sit-up
Desc: The decline bar press sit-up is a weighted core exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, particularly the lower abs. It also challenges the shoulders and upper back to move the weight. Weighted sit-up variations are usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of the core-focused portion of a workout.
HowTo: Lie on a decline bench with a barbell held above your chest. Engage your core and perform a sit-up by pressing the barbell upward while lifting your torso towards your knees. Lower back down and repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Pallof press
Desc: The Pallof press is an isometric exercise that trains core stability. It involves resisting rotation from a cable or band, developing what is sometimes called "anti-rotation" core strength. It is most often seen in programs for athletes who compete in sports that test strength, power, and functional movements. It can be trained in timed holds or for reps by pressing the cable or band away from the body.
HowTo: Stand with a cable or resistance band attached at chest height. Hold the handle with both hands and step away to create tension. Press the handle away from your chest while resisting rotation, then return to the starting position. Perform for time or a set number of reps.

Title: Weighted Sit-Ups - With Bands
Desc: The weighted sit-up is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement. The simple addition of a weight makes the sit-up far more difficult, providing a different stimulus to the core during training and helping build strong abs.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest. Engage your core and lift your torso towards your knees, then lower back down. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Suitcase crunch
Desc: The suitcase crunch is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It is similar to a V-up, but the lower back stays flat against the ground. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Lift your shoulders off the ground while bringing your knees towards your chest, mimicking a suitcase closing. Keep your lower back flat against the ground. Perform for time or reps.

Title: FYR Rope Jumping
Desc: Jumping rope is classic conditioning exercise that is popular with everyone from children to boxers to CrossFit athletes. It targets many different muscles, including the calves, glutes, shoulders, and upper back, and is great for everything from fat loss to improving overall athletic performance.
Muscles: Calves, Glutes, Shoulders, Upper Back, Abdominals
HowTo: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the rope handles. Begin jumping by swinging the rope over your head and jumping as it passes your feet. Keep a steady rhythm and maintain a light bounce on your toes. Continue for a set duration or number of jumps.

Title: Barbell press sit-up
Desc: The barbell press sit-up is a weighted exercise focusing on the abdominal muscles, as well as the shoulders to a lesser degree. It primarily targets the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, but also involves the obliques and deep core muscles. It can be performed on the floor with the feet anchored or unanchored, or on a decline or other bench. It is similar to the Otis-up, which is performed with a weight plate.
Muscles: Abdominals, Rectus Abdominis, Obliques, Deep Core Muscles, Shoulders
HowTo: Lie on your back with your feet anchored or unanchored. Hold a barbell above your chest with both hands. Engage your core and perform a sit-up while pressing the barbell upward. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Single-arm bent-over rear delt fly
Desc: The single-arm bent-over rear delt fly is a popular upper-body exercise that targets the muscles on the back of the shoulder joint, specifically the rear head of the deltoid. Since pressing movements build the front and (to a lesser degree) side deltoid heads, this move is often done to promote balanced shoulder development. It is usually performed for high reps, such as 10-15 reps per set or more, as part of a shoulder or upper-body workout.
HowTo: Stand bent over at the hips with a dumbbell in one hand. Keep your back flat and your core engaged. Raise the dumbbell out to the side, squeezing your shoulder blade at the top of the movement. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Captain's chair leg raise
Desc: The captain's chair leg raise is a bodyweight exercise that targets the abs. It is performed on an apparatus that allows the forearms to rest on pads and the upright torso to hang freely. Leg raise variations are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training.
HowTo: To perform the Captain's chair leg raise, start by positioning yourself on the captain's chair apparatus. Rest your forearms on the pads and allow your torso to hang freely. Engage your core and raise your legs by bending at the hips and knees, bringing your knees towards your chest. Lower your legs back to the starting position with control. Aim for 8-12 reps.

Title: Shoulder-Elevated One-Leg Hip Thrusts
Desc: Shoulder-Elevated One-Leg Hip Thrusts are an advanced variation of the hip thrust exercise that targets the glutes, hamstrings, and core. This exercise involves elevating one leg while thrusting the hips upward, which increases the difficulty and engages the stabilizing muscles. To perform, lie on your back with your shoulders on an elevated surface, bend one knee, and keep the other leg extended. Push through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top before lowering back down.
HowTo: To perform Shoulder-Elevated One-Leg Hip Thrusts, lie on your back with your shoulders resting on an elevated surface, such as a bench. Bend one knee and place your foot flat on the ground while extending the other leg straight. Push through the heel of the bent leg to lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. Lower your hips back down and repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.

Title: Ab Twist - Gethin Variation
Desc: The cross-body sit-up is a bodyweight exercise targeting the ab muscles, the obliques and rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It involves bringing the opposite-side knee and elbow together, usually alternating sides with each rep. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: To perform the Ab Twist - Gethin Variation, lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head. As you lift your upper body, twist to bring your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg. Lower back down and alternate sides, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee. Continue alternating for the desired number of reps.

Title: Weighted Crunch - Gethin Variation
Desc: The weighted sit-up is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement. The simple addition of a weight makes the sit-up far more difficult, providing a different stimulus to the core during training and helping build strong abs.
HowTo: To perform the Weighted Crunch - Gethin Variation, lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, squeezing your abs at the top. Lower back down with control. Perform for the desired number of reps.

Title: Ab Wheel Roll-Out - Gethin Variation
Desc: The ab wheel roll-out is an exercise targeting the abdominals, often with an inexpensive wheel device with a handle on either side. Many trainers and strength coaches claim it's one of, if no the best exercise for developing strength in the midsection. Beginners may have to start with a limited range of motion or just wheel planks.
HowTo: To perform the Ab Wheel Roll-Out - Gethin Variation, kneel on the floor and grip the handles of the ab wheel. Start with the wheel close to your knees. Engage your core and roll the wheel forward, extending your body while keeping your back straight. Roll out as far as you can while maintaining control, then pull the wheel back towards your knees to return to the starting position. Beginners may start with a limited range of motion.

Title: Bench crunch
Desc: The bench crunch is a popular ab exercise performed lying on a bench. It is largely similar to the same exercise performed on the floor, but being able to press the lower back into the bench pad can help reinforce proper form and increase the burn in the abs. Like most crunch variations, it is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.
HowTo: To perform the Bench Crunch, lie on your back on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and knees bent. Place your hands behind your head. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, pressing your lower back into the bench for support. Lower back down with control. Aim for 8-12 reps.

Title: Decline plate sit-up twist
Desc: The decline plate sit-up twist is a weighted core exercise that works the obliques and rectus abdominis or "six pack" muscles, as well as the deep core muscles. Weighted sit-up variations are usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of the core-focused portion of a workout.
HowTo: To perform the Decline Plate Sit-Up Twist, lie on a decline bench with your feet secured. Hold a weight plate against your chest. Engage your core and perform a sit-up, twisting your torso to one side at the top of the movement. Lower back down and alternate twisting sides with each rep. Aim for 8-12 reps.

Title: Reverse ab roll-out
Desc: The reverse ab roll-out is an exercise targeting the abdominals. It's a twist on the ab wheel roll-out, and is similar to a body saw exercise, only performed on a foam roller. Instead of your arms moving and your lower body remaining stationary, your lower body moves and your arms remain stationary. Beginners may need to use a limited range of motion.
HowTo: To perform the Reverse Ab Roll-Out, start in a plank position with your feet on a foam roller. Keep your arms stationary and engage your core as you roll your legs back, moving the foam roller away from your body. Roll back to the starting position while maintaining control. Beginners may need to limit their range of motion.

Title: 30 Seated Twist With PVC Pipe
Desc: The seated bar twist is a core exercise aiming to strengthen the obliques.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Hold a PVC pipe with both hands, arms extended in front of you. Rotate your torso to one side, keeping your hips grounded. Return to the center and rotate to the other side. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Suspended crunch-
Desc: The suspended crunch is an abdominal exercise performed with the feet in the stirrups of a suspension strap system. It targets the muscles of the core, most prominently the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, but also taxes the shoulders and deep core muscles.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Deep Core Muscles, Shoulders
HowTo: Attach your feet into the stirrups of the suspension strap system. Lie back on the ground, engaging your core. Pull your knees towards your chest while curling your upper body off the ground. Lower back down with control and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Suspended oblique crunch
Desc: The suspended oblique crunch is an abdominal exercise performed with the feet in the stirrups of a suspension strap system. It targets the muscles of the core, most prominently the obliques, but also the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, the shoulders, and deep core muscles.
Muscles: Obliques, Rectus Abdominis, Deep Core Muscles, Shoulders
HowTo: Attach your feet into the stirrups of the suspension strap system. Lie back on the ground and engage your core. Pull your knees towards one side while curling your upper body off the ground, focusing on your obliques. Alternate sides and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Weighted sit-up
Desc: The weighted sit-up is a more difficult version of a highly popular abdominal movement. The simple addition of a weight makes the sit-up far more difficult, providing a different stimulus to the core during training and helping build strong abs.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a weight against your chest or behind your head. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, then lower back down with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: 30 Decline Press Sit-Up
Desc: The decline bar press sit-up is a core and upper body exercise targeting the lower abdominals and shoulders.
HowTo: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured. Hold a weight behind your head or across your chest. Engage your core and perform a sit-up by lifting your upper body towards your knees. Lower back down with control and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Towel Reverse Plank Alternating Heel Pull-in
Desc: The Holman Towel Reverse Plank Alternating Heel Pull-in is an exercise that targets the core, glutes, and shoulders. Begin in a reverse plank position with your feet on a towel. Pull one heel towards your glutes while keeping your hips elevated, then alternate sides. This movement enhances stability and strength in the posterior chain.
HowTo: Start in a reverse plank position with your feet on a towel. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. Pull one heel towards your glutes while maintaining hip elevation, then return to the starting position and alternate sides. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Boat with Weighted Cross Punch
Desc: The Holman Boat with Weighted Cross Punch is a dynamic core exercise that combines balance and strength. Start in a boat pose with your legs lifted and bent at the knees, holding a weight in one hand. Rotate your torso to punch across your body with the weight, engaging your core. Alternate sides to work both obliques and improve coordination.
HowTo: Begin in a boat pose with your legs lifted and bent at the knees. Hold a weight in one hand. Rotate your torso to punch across your body with the weight, engaging your core. Return to the center and alternate sides. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Weighted Hook Punch
Desc: The Holman Weighted Hook Punch is a powerful upper body exercise that focuses on the shoulders, arms, and core. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight in one hand. Perform a hook punch by rotating your hips and shoulders while bringing your arm across your body. This exercise enhances punching power and overall upper body strength.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight in one hand. Rotate your hips and shoulders to perform a hook punch across your body, engaging your core. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

Title: Holman Weighted Traveling Punch
Desc: The Holman Weighted Traveling Punch is a dynamic exercise that combines a punch motion with a weighted resistance to enhance upper body strength and coordination. Perform this exercise by standing with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight in one hand, and executing a punch while stepping forward.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight in one hand. Execute a punch while stepping forward, engaging your core and maintaining balance.

Title: Holman Weighted Uppercut Punch
Desc: The Holman Weighted Uppercut Punch focuses on building strength in the arms and shoulders while engaging the core. To perform, stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold a weight in one hand, and drive your fist upward in an uppercut motion, alternating sides.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight in one hand. Drive your fist upward in an uppercut motion, alternating sides while keeping your core engaged.

Title: Holman Slow Weighted Double Pike
Desc: The Holman Slow Weighted Double Pike is an advanced core exercise that targets the abdominal muscles and hip flexors. Begin in a plank position, then slowly lift both legs towards your chest while maintaining a pike position, holding a weight for added resistance.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. Slowly lift both legs towards your chest while maintaining a pike position, holding a weight for added resistance.

Title: Holman Plate Straight Plank Reach
Desc: The Holman Plate Straight Plank Reach is a stability exercise that engages the core and shoulders. Start in a straight plank position with a weight plate in front of you, then reach forward to grab the plate with one hand, alternating sides while maintaining your plank.
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position with a weight plate in front of you. Reach forward with one hand to grab the plate, alternating sides while keeping your body straight.

Title: Holman Plate Elbow Plank Jack to Straight Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Plate Elbow Plank Jack to Straight Plank Jack combines core stability with dynamic movement. Begin in an elbow plank position, then jump your feet out to the sides and back together, transitioning to a straight plank after each jack.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position. Jump your feet out to the sides and back together, then transition to a straight plank after each jack.

Title: Holman Plate Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Plate Hill Climber is a high-intensity exercise that targets the core, shoulders, and legs. Start in a plank position with a weight plate under your hands, then drive your knees towards your chest in a quick, alternating motion.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with a weight plate under your hands. Drive your knees towards your chest in a quick, alternating motion, keeping your core tight.

Title: Holman Plate Reverse Plank Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Plate Reverse Plank Hill Climber is a unique twist on the traditional hill climber that targets the posterior chain. Begin in a reverse plank position with your feet on a weight plate, then alternate bringing your knees towards your chest.
HowTo: Begin in a reverse plank position with your feet on a weight plate. Alternate bringing your knees towards your chest while keeping your hips elevated.

Title: Holman Plate Straight Plank Pike to Jack
Desc: The Holman Plate Straight Plank Pike to Jack is a full-body exercise that challenges your core and coordination. Start in a straight plank position with a weight plate, then pike your hips up towards the ceiling before jumping your feet out and back together.
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position with a weight plate. Pike your hips up towards the ceiling, then jump your feet out to the sides and back together.

Title: Holman Plate In-and-Out Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Plate In-and-Out Push-Up is a dynamic exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and core. Start in a push-up position with a plate under your hands. As you lower your body, jump your feet in towards the plate and then back out as you push up.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position with a plate under your hands. Lower your body while jumping your feet in towards the plate, then push up and jump your feet back out.

Title: Holman Plate Burpee
Desc: The Holman Plate Burpee combines a squat, push-up, and jump for a full-body workout. Begin in a standing position, drop into a squat while placing your hands on the plate, kick your feet back into a push-up position, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back to the squat and explode upwards into a jump.
