It is often taught as a precursor to the full Turkish get-up, but is also a valuable abdominal and shoulder exercise in its own right. It can be performed for reps or time, either in lower rep ranges for strength or higher rep ranges for technique practice or conditioning.
HowTo: To perform the half Turkish get-up, lie on your back holding a kettlebell in one hand. Bend the knee on the same side and keep the other leg extended. Push through your elbow to lift your torso while keeping the kettlebell overhead. Stand up partially, then return to the starting position. Perform for 5-10 reps on each side.

Title: 30 Hanging Oblique Crunch
Desc: The hanging oblique crunch an abdominal exercise that targets both the rectus abdominus or “six-pack” muscles, and the oblique muscles. It can be performed hanging from a bar, or if grip strength is a limitation, by placing the elbows in ab straps. If hanging from a straight bar is uncomfortable to the wrists or shoulder, you can also perform them hanging with a neutral grip (palms facing one another)
HowTo: Hang from a bar or use ab straps to support your elbows. Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest while keeping your legs bent. Focus on contracting your obliques as you raise your knees.

Title: 30 Hollow-Body Hold
Desc: The hollow-body hold is an isometric exercise that increases strength and stability in the core muscles. It is common in gymnastics training, CrossFit training, and as a core tension and bracing drill for lifters and athletes of all types. It is performed for time and can be performed as an activation drill prior to lifting, as part of a circuit, or as equipment-free core training anytime.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight. Lift your shoulders and legs off the ground, creating a 'hollow' shape with your body. Hold this position for the desired time, keeping your core engaged.

Title: Parallel bars knee raise
Desc: The parallel bars knee raise is a bodyweight exercise that targets the abs. It is performed on parallel bars, starting in the top position of a dip. Knee raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training.
HowTo: Start in the top position of a dip on parallel bars. Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest while keeping your legs bent. Lower your legs back down without swinging, maintaining control throughout the movement.

Title: 30 Landmine Twist
Desc: The landmine twist is a rotational abdominal movement performed utilizing an angled barbell anchored at floor level in a landmine device. It can also be performed by sticking a barbell in the corner of a room, preferably in a towel to protect the walls. It targets the deep muscles of the core, including both the obliques and the transversus abdominus. It can be done fast or slow, for time or reps, either in traditional muscle-focused rep ranges such as 8-12 reps per side.
HowTo: Stand facing a landmine device with a barbell anchored at one end. Hold the other end of the barbell with both hands, arms extended. Rotate your torso to one side, then the other, engaging your core throughout the movement. Perform for the desired reps or time.

Title: Parallel bars leg raise
Desc: The parallel bars leg raise is a bodyweight exercise that targets the abs. It is performed on parallel bars, starting in the top position of a dip. Leg raises are often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps or more, as part of ab-focused training. However, this difficult variation may require some time to build up to those rep ranges.
HowTo: Start in the top position of a dip on parallel bars. Engage your core and lift your legs straight up towards the ceiling, keeping them together. Lower your legs back down with control without swinging.

Title: Otis-up-
Desc: The Otis-up is a weighted exercise focusing on the abdominal muscles and the shoulders to a lesser degree. It primarily targets the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles, but also involves the obliques and deep core muscles. It is normally performed on a decline bench holding a weight plate, but can also be performed with a dumbbell, kettlebell, or other weight.
HowTo: Lie on a decline bench holding a weight plate above your chest. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, then lower back down with control. Focus on using your abdominal muscles throughout the movement.

Title: 30 Shoulder Tap
Desc: The shoulder tap is an exercise targeting the abdominals and core. The basic stance matches the top of a push-up position. From there, one hand is raised to tap its opposing shoulder. A tap with each hand to each opposing shoulder equals one rep.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position. Lift one hand off the ground and tap the opposite shoulder, then return it to the ground. Alternate hands, ensuring your hips remain stable and your core is engaged.

Title: 30 Spider Crawl
Desc: The spider crawl is a bodyweight exercise that involves crawling on the floor with the knees outside of the elbows. It is different from a leopard crawl in that the hips are higher, and it's different from a bear crawl because the knees are wider. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, in short bursts for power or circuit training, or for longer durations as cardiovascular conditioning.
HowTo: Begin in a squat position with your hands on the ground. Crawl forward by moving one hand and the opposite foot simultaneously, keeping your knees outside your elbows. Continue crawling forward for the desired distance or time.

Title: Spider crunch
Desc: The spider crunch is a core exercise that begins in a straight-arm plank position and involves raising one knee toward your same-side elbow to target the obliques. It is similar to a mountain climber, but with the knees out wider. It can be performed for time or reps as bodyweight ab training or conditioning.
HowTo: Start in a straight-arm plank position. Raise your right knee toward your right elbow, keeping your core engaged. Return to the plank position and repeat on the left side. Continue alternating sides for the desired time or number of reps.

Title: Toe-touch
Desc: The toe-touch is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your legs extended and arms reaching overhead. Simultaneously lift your legs and upper body, reaching for your toes. Lower back down with control and repeat for the desired time or number of reps.

Title: 30 Hanging Toes-To-Bar
Desc: The hanging toes-to-bar is an advanced abdominal exercise in which the lifter touches their feet to a pull-up bar. There are many ways to perform this movement: strict or swinging, arms completely straight or slightly bent, legs straight or bent, each providing unique benefits and challenges. Initially, it may be a difficult move to do for a single rep, but once you build the requisite core, lat, and shoulder strength, it can be performed for higher reps.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Hip Flexors, Lats, Shoulders
HowTo: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended. Engage your core and lift your legs towards the bar, aiming to touch your toes to it. Lower your legs back down with control and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: 30 V-Up
Desc: The V-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It is similar to a suitcase crunch, but the lower back lifts off the ground at the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your legs extended and arms reaching overhead. Lift your legs and upper body simultaneously, forming a V shape at the top of the movement. Lower back down with control and repeat for the desired time or number of reps.

Title: Cocoon crunch
Desc: The cocoon crunch is a bodyweight exercise targeting the ab muscles, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It involves bringing your knees to your chest and your arms from overhead to center. It can be performed for time or reps as part of the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. Bring your knees towards your chest while simultaneously bringing your arms down to meet your knees. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired time or number of reps.

Title: Bench oblique crunch
Desc: The bench oblique crunch is an exercise that targets the obliques, the muscles running alongside the rectus abdominis. The range of motion is fairly small, but it still does a great job of working these hard-to-isolate muscles. Like most crunch variations, it is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.
HowTo: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and knees bent. Place your hands behind your head. Crunch up, bringing your shoulder blades off the bench while twisting your torso to one side to target the obliques. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of reps, alternating sides.

Title: Full moon-
Desc: The full moon is a bodyweight exercise targeting the muscles of the abs. It is similar to a V-up, but with the added challenge of “drawing” a circle shape in the air during each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the core-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your legs extended and arms reaching overhead. Lift your legs and upper body while simultaneously drawing a circle in the air with your arms. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired time or number of reps.

Title: Push-up to side plank
Desc: The push-up to side plank is an upper-body and core-focused exercise combining two popular bodyweight movements. It targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders with the push-up, and the obliques and hip external rotator muscles with the side plank. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up or any bodyweight strength-training workout.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position. Perform a push-up, then rotate your body to one side, lifting your arm towards the ceiling into a side plank. Return to the push-up position and repeat on the other side. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps.

Title: Tyler Holt V-Up
Desc: The Tyler Holt V-Up is an abdominal exercise that targets the core. Start by lying on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. Simultaneously lift your legs and upper body off the ground, reaching your hands towards your feet, then lower back down.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. Simultaneously lift your legs and upper body off the ground, reaching your hands towards your feet. Lower back down to the starting position.

Title: Tyler Holt Plank
Desc: The Tyler Holt Plank is a core stability exercise that engages multiple muscle groups. Begin in a push-up position, resting on your forearms and toes, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Hold this position for a set duration.
HowTo: Begin in a push-up position, resting on your forearms and toes. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels and hold this position for a set duration.

Title: Tyler Holt Hip-Dip
Desc: The Tyler Holt Hip-Dip is a variation of the plank that targets the obliques. Start in a forearm plank position, then rotate your hips to one side, dipping them towards the ground, and return to the center. Alternate sides.
HowTo: Start in a forearm plank position. Rotate your hips to one side, dipping them towards the ground, then return to the center. Alternate sides.

Title: Suicides
Desc: Suicides are a high-intensity interval training exercise that improves agility and cardiovascular fitness. Set up markers at various distances, sprint to the first marker and back, then to the second, and so on, until you complete the sequence.
HowTo: Set up markers at various distances. Sprint to the first marker and back, then to the second marker and back, continuing this pattern until you complete the sequence.

Title: Holman Towel Straight Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Towel Straight Plank Jack combines a plank with a jumping jack motion. Start in a plank position with a towel under your feet. Jump your feet out wide and then back together while maintaining a strong plank.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with a towel under your feet. Jump your feet out wide and then back together while maintaining a strong plank.

Title: Holman Towel Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Towel Hill Climber is a dynamic exercise that targets the core and improves cardiovascular fitness. Begin in a plank position with a towel under your feet. Drive one knee towards your chest and then switch legs quickly, as if running in place.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with a towel under your feet. Drive one knee towards your chest, then switch legs quickly, as if running in place.

Title: Holman Towel Elbow Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Towel Elbow Plank Jack is a variation of the plank jack that engages the core. Start in an elbow plank position with a towel under your feet. Jump your feet out wide and back together while keeping your elbows and toes on the ground.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position with a towel under your feet. Jump your feet out wide and back together while keeping your elbows and toes on the ground.

Title: Holman Towel Elbow Plank Pike
Desc: The Holman Towel Elbow Plank Pike is an advanced core exercise. Start in an elbow plank position with a towel under your feet. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, bringing your feet towards your hands, then return to the plank position.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position with a towel under your feet. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, bringing your feet towards your hands, then return to the plank position.

Title: Holman Towel Straight Plank Hand Reach
Desc: Start in a straight plank position with your hands on a towel. Reach one arm forward while maintaining a stable core and straight body line. Alternate arms.
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position with your hands on a towel. Reach one arm forward while maintaining a stable core and straight body line. Alternate arms.

Title: Holman Towel Wax-On Wax-Off
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a towel in both hands. Move your arms in a circular motion as if waxing a car, engaging your core throughout.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a towel in both hands. Move your arms in a circular motion as if waxing a car, engaging your core throughout.

Title: Holman Towel Wide Hill Climber
Desc: Begin in a high plank position with your feet on a towel. Drive one knee towards your chest while sliding the towel, then return to the starting position and alternate.
HowTo: Begin in a high plank position with your feet on a towel. Drive one knee towards your chest while sliding the towel, then return to the starting position and alternate legs.

Title: Holman Towel Dirty Dog
Desc: Start in a plank position with one knee bent and the towel under your foot. Lift your foot off the ground and extend your leg back while keeping your core tight.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with one knee bent and the towel under your foot. Lift your foot off the ground and extend your leg back while keeping your core tight.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Shoulder Tap
Desc: In a straight plank position, lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while keeping your hips stable. Alternate sides.
HowTo: In a straight plank position, lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while keeping your hips stable. Alternate sides.

Title: Holman Killer Abs
Desc: Lie on your back with your feet on a towel. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, pulling the towel towards you while keeping your legs straight.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your feet on a towel. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground, pulling the towel towards you while keeping your legs straight.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Split Jack
Desc: Start in a plank position with your feet on a towel. Jump your feet out to the sides and back together while maintaining a strong plank position.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your feet on a towel. Jump your feet out to the sides and back together while maintaining a strong plank position.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Swim
Desc: Begin in an elbow plank position. Extend one arm forward while rotating your torso slightly, then alternate arms while keeping your hips level.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position. Extend one arm forward while rotating your torso slightly, then alternate arms while keeping your hips level.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Saw
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Saw is an advanced core exercise that engages the abdominal muscles while promoting stability. Start in an elbow plank position, then saw your body forward and backward, maintaining a strong core and straight body line.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position. Engage your core and maintain a straight body line. Slowly saw your body forward and backward, keeping your elbows under your shoulders.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Toe-Tap Series
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Toe-Tap Series targets the core and shoulders. Begin in a straight plank with your feet elevated. Alternate tapping your toes out to the side while keeping your body stable and aligned.
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position with your feet elevated. Keep your body straight and stable. Alternate tapping your toes out to the side while maintaining alignment.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Pike Pull
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Pike Pull is a dynamic core exercise. Start in an elbow plank position, then lift your hips towards the ceiling into a pike position, followed by pulling your body back into the plank. Engage your core throughout.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling into a pike position. Then, pull your body back into the plank position, keeping your core engaged throughout.

Title: Holman Hand-Elevated Walk-Over Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Hand-Elevated Walk-Over Push-Up is a variation of the standard push-up that increases difficulty. With your hands elevated on a surface, perform a push-up and walk your hands to one side, then back to the center.
HowTo: With your hands elevated on a surface, start in a push-up position. Perform a push-up, then walk your hands to one side, and return to the center before repeating.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Hill Climber combines cardio and core strength. In a high plank position with hands elevated, alternate bringing your knees to your chest quickly while maintaining a strong plank posture.
HowTo: In a high plank position with hands elevated, engage your core. Alternate bringing your knees towards your chest quickly while maintaining a strong plank posture.

Title: Holman Seated Pike
Desc: The Holman Seated Pike is a flexibility and core strength exercise. Sit on the floor with your legs extended. Lean forward while keeping your back straight, reaching towards your toes to engage your core and stretch your hamstrings.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Keep your back straight and lean forward, reaching towards your toes to engage your core and stretch your hamstrings.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Up-Down Plank
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Up-Down Plank is a full-body workout that challenges your core and stability. Start in a plank with feet elevated, then lower your body down to your elbows and back up, alternating sides.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your feet elevated. Lower your body down to your elbows one side at a time, then push back up to your hands, alternating sides.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hand Tap
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Hand Tap is a core stability exercise. In a plank position with feet elevated, alternate tapping your opposite shoulder with your hand while keeping your hips steady and minimizing rotation.
HowTo: In a plank position with feet elevated, engage your core. Alternate tapping your opposite shoulder with your hand while keeping your hips steady and minimizing rotation.

Title: Holman Reverse Straight Plank with Alternating Heel Pull-In
Desc: Begin in a reverse plank position with your body in a straight line. Alternate pulling your heels towards your glutes while maintaining a strong core and straight body.
HowTo: Begin in a reverse plank position with your body in a straight line. Alternate pulling your heels towards your glutes while maintaining a strong core and straight body.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank
Desc: Start in an elbow plank position with your forearms on the ground and body in a straight line. Engage your core and hold the position, focusing on stability.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position with your forearms on the ground and body in a straight line. Engage your core and hold the position, focusing on stability.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Squat Thrust
Desc: Begin in a straight plank position. Lower your body into a squat and then thrust back into the plank position. Repeat for desired repetitions.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Transverse Abdominis, Quadriceps, Shoulders
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position. Lower your body into a squat and then thrust back into the plank position. Repeat for desired repetitions.

Title: Holman Alternating Single-Leg Pike
Desc: Start in a plank position. Lift one leg towards the ceiling while keeping your core engaged. Alternate legs for a full set.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Transverse Abdominis, Hip Flexors, Glutes
HowTo: Start in a plank position. Lift one leg towards the ceiling while keeping your core engaged. Alternate legs for a full set.

Title: Holman Knee Pull-In Crunch
Desc: Lie on your back with knees bent. Pull your knees towards your chest while lifting your head and shoulders off the ground, engaging your core.
HowTo: Lie on your back with knees bent. Pull your knees towards your chest while lifting your head and shoulders off the ground, engaging your core.

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Hand Tap
Desc: Begin in a straight plank position. Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while maintaining balance and a strong core. Alternate sides.
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position. Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while maintaining balance and a strong core. Alternate sides.

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Dirty Dog
Desc: Start in a straight plank position. Lift one leg and bend it at the knee, bringing it towards your side while keeping your core engaged. Alternate legs.
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position. Lift one leg and bend it at the knee, bringing it towards your side while keeping your core engaged. Alternate legs.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Roll
Desc: Begin in an elbow plank position. Rotate your body to one side, lifting your arm towards the ceiling, then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position. Rotate your body to one side, lifting your arm towards the ceiling, then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Froggy Push-Up
Desc: Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower your body to the ground, then push back up. Jump your feet towards your hands, then jump back to the starting position. Repeat.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position with hands shoulder-width apart. Lower your body to the ground, then push back up. Jump your feet towards your hands, then jump back to the starting position. Repeat.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Hand Tap to Shoulder Tap
Desc: Begin in a straight plank position. Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder, then return it to the ground. Alternate sides while maintaining a stable core.
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position. Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder, then return it to the ground. Alternate sides while maintaining a stable core.

Title: Holman In-Out Straight Plank
Desc: Start in a straight plank position. Jump your feet towards your hands, then jump back to the plank position. Repeat the in-and-out motion while keeping your core engaged.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Transverse Abdominis, Hip Flexors
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position. Jump your feet towards your hands, then jump back to the plank position. Repeat the in-and-out motion while keeping your core engaged.

Title: Holman Bicycle
Desc: Lie on your back with your knees bent. Bring your elbows to your knees while extending your legs out. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent. Bring your elbows to your knees while extending your legs out. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion.

Title: Holman Alternating Diagonal Knee Pull-in
Desc: Start in a standing position. Bring one knee up towards your chest while extending the opposite arm diagonally. Alternate sides in a controlled manner.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Bring one knee up towards your chest while extending the opposite arm diagonally. Alternate sides in a controlled manner.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank with Step-Out
Desc: Begin in an elbow plank position. Step one foot out to the side, then return it to the center. Alternate sides while keeping your core tight.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position. Step one foot out to the side, then return it to the center. Alternate sides while keeping your core tight.

Title: Holman Alternating Slow L-Raise
Desc: Lie on your back with your legs straight. Raise one leg slowly towards the ceiling while keeping the other leg on the ground. Alternate legs while maintaining control.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your legs straight. Raise one leg slowly towards the ceiling while keeping the other leg on the ground. Alternate legs while maintaining control.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank with Shoulder Tap
Desc: Start in a plank position with your feet elevated on a surface. Tap one shoulder with the opposite hand, alternating sides while keeping your hips stable.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your feet elevated on a surface. Tap one shoulder with the opposite hand, alternating sides while keeping your hips stable.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Inchworm Pike to Straight Plank Push-Up
Desc: Start in a feet-elevated position with your hands on the ground. Perform an inchworm by walking your hands forward into a plank position, then execute a pike by lifting your hips up and back. Finally, lower into a straight plank push-up before returning to the starting position.
HowTo: Start in a feet-elevated position with your hands on the ground. Walk your hands forward into a plank position (inchworm), then lift your hips up and back (pike). Lower into a straight plank push-up, and return to the starting position.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Up-Down Elbow Plank
Desc: Begin in a feet-elevated plank position on your elbows. Alternate between lowering your body and pushing back up, engaging your core and maintaining a straight line from head to heels.
HowTo: Begin in a feet-elevated plank position on your elbows. Alternate lowering your body down and pushing back up while engaging your core and keeping a straight line from head to heels.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Pike Pull
Desc: Start in a feet-elevated plank position. Perform a pike by lifting your hips towards the ceiling, then pull your body forward into a plank position before returning to the starting position.
HowTo: Start in a feet-elevated plank position. Lift your hips towards the ceiling (pike), then pull your body forward into a plank position before returning to the starting position.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Alternating Single-Leg Hip Raise
Desc: Lie on your back with your feet elevated. Raise one leg towards the ceiling while pushing through your heel on the elevated surface, alternating legs to engage your glutes and hamstrings.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your feet elevated. Raise one leg towards the ceiling while pushing through your heel on the elevated surface, then alternate legs to engage your glutes and hamstrings.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Pike Pull to Push-Up
Desc: Begin in a feet-elevated plank position. Perform a pike by lifting your hips up, then transition into a push-up before returning to the plank position.
HowTo: Begin in a feet-elevated plank position. Lift your hips up (pike), then transition into a push-up before returning to the plank position.

Title: Holman Standing Heel Click
Desc: Stand tall with your feet together. Jump and click your heels together while raising your arms overhead, then return to the starting position.
HowTo: Stand tall with your feet together. Jump and click your heels together while raising your arms overhead, then return to the starting position.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Right-Left Jack to Split Jack
Desc: Start in a straight plank position. Perform a right-left jack by jumping your feet out and in while maintaining a strong core, then transition into a split jack by jumping your feet wide and back together.
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position. Perform a right-left jack by jumping your feet out and in while maintaining a strong core, then transition into a split jack by jumping your feet wide and back together.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Ninja Knees
Desc: Begin in an elbow plank position. Perform a jack by jumping your feet out and in, then transition into a ninja knee by bringing one knee towards your chest, alternating sides.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position. Perform a jack by jumping your feet out and in, then transition into a ninja knee by bringing one knee towards your chest, alternating sides.

Title: Holman Right Side Elbow Plank with Left Leg Swing
Desc: Start in a right side elbow plank position, engaging your core. Swing your left leg forward and backward in a controlled manner, maintaining stability in your torso.
HowTo: Start in a right side elbow plank position, engaging your core. Swing your left leg forward and backward in a controlled manner, maintaining stability in your torso.

Desc: Begin in a left side elbow plank position, keeping your body straight. Swing your right leg forward and backward, focusing on balance and core engagement.

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Diagonal Sit-Back
Desc: Assume a straight plank position on your hands. Alternate bringing each knee towards your chest, then sit back into a slight squat before returning to plank.
HowTo: Assume a straight plank position on your hands. Alternate bringing each knee towards your chest, then sit back into a slight squat before returning to plank.

Title: Holman Boat Press with Leg Extension

HowTo: Sit on the floor with your legs extended. Press your hands together at your chest, then extend your legs while leaning back slightly, engaging your core.

Title: Holman Shoulder Tap to Dirty Dog

Title: Holman Standing Russian Twist
Desc: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Twist your torso to the right while bringing your hands together, then return to center and twist to the left.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Twist your torso to the right while bringing your hands together, then return to center and twist to the left.

HowTo: Begin in a hovering plank position on your forearms and toes. Alternate tapping each shoulder with the opposite hand while maintaining a stable core.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Stacked Plank Hip Drop
Desc: Start in an elbow plank position. Transition to a stacked plank by rotating your body and stacking your feet, then lower your hips to the side in a controlled manner.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Walk-Up Pike
Desc: Start in a plank position with your elbows under your shoulders. Engage your core and walk your feet towards your hands, lifting your hips into a pike position. Then walk back out to the plank position.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your elbows under your shoulders. Engage your core and walk your feet towards your hands, lifting your hips into a pike position. Then walk back out to the plank position.

Title: Holman Hill Climber
Desc: Begin in a high plank position. Drive one knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs in a running motion, keeping your core tight and back flat.
HowTo: Begin in a high plank position. Drive one knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs in a running motion, keeping your core tight and back flat.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Pike to Renegade Row
Desc: Start in a straight-arm plank position. Perform a pike by lifting your hips up and back, then return to plank and perform a renegade row by pulling one arm towards your waist while stabilizing your body.
HowTo: Start in a straight-arm plank position. Perform a pike by lifting your hips up and back, then return to plank and perform a renegade row by pulling one arm towards your waist while stabilizing your body.

Title: Holman Alternating Hip Drop to Push-Up
Desc: Begin in a plank position. Lower your hips to one side for a hip drop, then return to center and perform a push-up. Alternate sides with each repetition.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position. Lower your hips to one side for a hip drop, then return to center and perform a push-up. Alternate sides with each repetition.

Title: Holman Crab Kick
Desc: Sit in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground, lift your hips, and kick one leg out while reaching the opposite arm towards your foot. Alternate sides.
HowTo: Sit in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground, lift your hips, and kick one leg out while reaching the opposite arm towards your foot. Alternate sides.

Title: Holman Wounded Bear Crawl
Desc: Start on all fours in a bear crawl position. Lift your knees slightly off the ground and move forward in a crawling motion, keeping your core engaged and back flat.
HowTo: Start on all fours in a bear crawl position. Lift your knees slightly off the ground and move forward in a crawling motion, keeping your core engaged and back flat.

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Reach
Desc: Begin in a crab position. Reach one arm overhead while extending the opposite leg, then return to the starting position and alternate sides.
HowTo: Begin in a crab position. Reach one arm overhead while extending the opposite leg, then return to the starting position and alternate sides.

Title: Holman Hovering Panther Core Stabilizer
Desc: Start on all fours in a panther position with knees hovering above the ground. Engage your core and hold the position to stabilize your body.
HowTo: Start on all fours in a panther position with knees hovering above the ground. Engage your core and hold the position to stabilize your body.

Title: Holman Burpee to Forward Lunge
Desc: The Holman Burpee to Forward Lunge combines a traditional burpee with a forward lunge, enhancing strength and cardiovascular fitness. Start in a standing position, drop into a burpee, and as you jump back up, step forward into a lunge.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a burpee by placing your hands on the ground and jumping your feet back into a plank position. Perform a push-up if desired. Jump your feet back towards your hands, then explode upwards into a jump. As you land, step forward with one foot into a lunge.

Title: Holman Seated Knee Pull-In Series
Desc: The Holman Seated Knee Pull-In Series targets the core and hip flexors. Sit on the ground with your legs extended, then pull your knees toward your chest while leaning back slightly, engaging your abs.
HowTo: Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you. Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight. Pull your knees towards your chest, engaging your core. Hold the position briefly before extending your legs back out.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Pike
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Pike is a core-strengthening exercise. Begin in an elbow plank position, then lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position, and return to the plank.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position with your body straight. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. Hold for a moment, then lower your hips back down to return to the elbow plank.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Straight Plank Split Jack
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Jack to Straight Plank Split Jack combines core stability with dynamic movement. Start in an elbow plank, jump your feet out and in like a jumping jack, then transition to a straight plank and perform a split jack.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position. Jump your feet out wide, then back together like a jumping jack. Transition to a straight plank by extending your arms fully. From there, perform a split jack by jumping your feet out to the sides and back together.

Title: Holman Boat Pull-Over
Desc: The Holman Boat Pull-Over is a core and upper body exercise. Sit in a boat position with your legs lifted and straight, then hold a weight and perform a pull-over motion, engaging your core throughout.
HowTo: Sit in a boat position with your legs lifted and straight. Hold a weight with both hands above your chest. Engage your core and lower the weight behind your head in a pull-over motion, then return to the starting position.

Title: Holman Squat Pulse to Plyometric Jump
Desc: The Holman Squat Pulse to Plyometric Jump is a powerful lower body workout. Perform a squat with small pulses at the bottom, then explode upwards into a jump, landing softly and repeating.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat, keeping your chest up and weight in your heels. Perform small pulses at the bottom of the squat, then explode upwards into a plyometric jump. Land softly and immediately go back into the squat.

Title: Holman Hands Down Heel Click
Desc: The Holman Hands Down Heel Click is a fun and engaging exercise that targets the core and coordination. Start in a plank position, then lift one hand off the ground to click your heels together, alternating sides.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your body straight. Lift one hand off the ground and click your heels together while keeping your core engaged. Alternate sides, lifting each hand to click your heels.

Title: Holman Straight Plank to Kick-Up
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank to Kick-Up is a dynamic core exercise. Begin in a straight plank position, then kick one leg up towards the ceiling while maintaining stability in your core and shoulders.
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position with your body in a straight line. Engage your core and kick one leg up towards the ceiling while maintaining stability in your core and shoulders. Lower the leg back down and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Split Jack
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Split Jack is a dynamic exercise that combines a split stance with a jumping jack motion, elevating the hands to increase core engagement and stability.
HowTo: Start in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back. Jump up and spread your legs apart while raising your hands overhead. Land softly and return to the starting position.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Reach
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Plank Reach is a challenging plank variation where the feet are elevated, and you reach forward with one arm, engaging the core and improving balance.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with your feet elevated on a surface. Reach forward with one arm while keeping your core tight. Alternate arms while maintaining balance.

Title: Holman Hand-Elevated Side Plank Semicircle
Desc: The Holman Hand-Elevated Side Plank Semicircle involves holding a side plank position with one hand elevated while performing a semicircle motion with the top arm, enhancing shoulder stability and core strength.
HowTo: Lie on your side and elevate one hand on a surface. Hold a side plank position while moving your top arm in a semicircle motion above your body. Keep your core engaged throughout.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Straight Plank Pike
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Straight Plank Pike is an advanced plank variation where the hands are elevated, and the body is lifted into a pike position, targeting the core and shoulders.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your hands elevated. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. Hold briefly before returning to the plank.

Title: Holman Alternating Rolling Elbow Plank
Desc: The Holman Alternating Rolling Elbow Plank is a dynamic plank exercise where you roll from side to side on your elbows, engaging the obliques and improving overall core stability.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position. Roll your body to one side, then back to the center, and then to the other side. Engage your obliques as you move.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank Jack is a core-strengthening exercise that combines a plank hold on the elbows with a jumping jack motion of the feet, enhancing cardiovascular fitness and core stability.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position. Jump your feet out to the sides like a jumping jack and then back together while maintaining the plank position.

Title: Holman Squat Thrust to Alternating Knee-In
Desc: The Holman Squat Thrust to Alternating Knee-In is a full-body exercise that combines a squat thrust with bringing one knee to the chest, targeting the core, legs, and cardiovascular system.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position, drop into a squat, then thrust your feet back into a plank position. From there, bring one knee towards your chest, alternating sides.

Title: Holman Supine Double Pike
Desc: The Holman Supine Double Pike is a core-focused exercise performed lying on your back, where you lift both legs and arms simultaneously into a pike position, engaging the abdominal muscles.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. Simultaneously lift your arms and legs towards the ceiling into a pike position, then lower back down.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Alternating Pike
Desc: Start in a plank position on your elbows. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. Return to plank and alternate lifting each leg towards your chest.
HowTo: Start in a plank position on your elbows. Engage your core and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a pike position. Return to plank and alternate lifting each leg towards your chest.

Title: Holman Seated Killer Abs
Desc: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly and engage your core. Extend your legs and twist your torso to touch the ground beside you, alternating sides.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly and engage your core. Extend your legs and twist your torso to touch the ground beside you, alternating sides.

Title: Holman Side Plank Hip Drop
Desc: Begin in a side plank position on your elbow. Lower your hip towards the ground and then lift it back up, engaging your obliques throughout the movement.
HowTo: Begin in a side plank position on your elbow. Lower your hip towards the ground and then lift it back up, engaging your obliques throughout the movement.

Title: Holman Wide Hill Climber
Desc: Start in a high plank position. Quickly drive your knees towards your chest, alternating legs as if you are running in place while maintaining a strong core.
HowTo: Start in a high plank position. Quickly drive your knees towards your chest, alternating legs as if you are running in place while maintaining a strong core.

Title: Holman Straight-Legged Bicycle
Desc: Lie on your back with your legs extended. Lift your legs and shoulders off the ground, and alternate bringing your elbow to the opposite knee in a pedaling motion.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your legs extended. Lift your legs and shoulders off the ground, and alternate bringing your elbow to the opposite knee in a pedaling motion.

Title: Holman Stair Toe Tap
Desc: Stand in front of a stair or step. Alternate tapping your toes on the step while keeping your core engaged and maintaining a steady rhythm.
HowTo: Stand in front of a stair or step. Alternate tapping your toes on the step while keeping your core engaged and maintaining a steady rhythm.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank Ninja
Desc: Begin in an elbow plank position. Jump your feet out to the sides and back in, while maintaining a strong core and stable upper body.
HowTo: Begin in an elbow plank position. Jump your feet out to the sides and back in, while maintaining a strong core and stable upper body.

Title: Holman Traveling Stair Climb Push-Up
Desc: Start in a high plank position. Perform a push-up, then step or jump your feet towards your hands and climb the stairs with a quick motion before returning to plank.
HowTo: Start in a high plank position. Perform a push-up, then step or jump your feet towards your hands and climb the stairs with a quick motion before returning to plank.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Burpee
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Burpee combines a traditional burpee with an elevated hand position to increase upper body engagement and core stability.
HowTo: Start in a standing position, then drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. Jump your feet back into a plank position, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands and explosively jump up with your hands raised.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Donkey Kick
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Donkey Kick is an exercise that targets the core and glutes, performed in a plank position while kicking one leg back at a time.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with your body straight. Lift one leg and kick it back while keeping your core engaged. Alternate legs, ensuring to maintain a stable plank position throughout.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Pike Pull
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Straight Plank Pike Pull involves elevating the feet while in a plank position and pulling the body into a pike position, enhancing core strength.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your feet elevated on a surface. Engage your core and pull your hips up towards the ceiling, forming a pike position, then return to the plank.

Title: Holman Towel Burpee
Desc: The Holman Towel Burpee incorporates a towel for added resistance and grip, challenging both strength and coordination during the burpee movement.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position, then drop into a squat and place your hands on the towel on the ground. Jump your feet back into a plank position, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands, grabbing the towel, and explosively jump up.

Title: Holman Elbow Plank to Alternating Side Plank Crunch
Desc: The Holman Elbow Plank to Alternating Side Plank Crunch is a dynamic movement that transitions from an elbow plank to a side plank while bringing the knee to the elbow.
HowTo: Start in an elbow plank position. Rotate your body to one side into a side plank while bringing your knee towards your elbow. Return to the elbow plank and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman Straight-Legged Hip Raise
Desc: The Holman Straight-Legged Hip Raise focuses on the glutes and hamstrings, performed by raising the hips while keeping the legs straight.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your legs straight. Engage your glutes and hamstrings to lift your hips towards the ceiling while keeping your legs straight, then lower back down.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Hill Climber increases the intensity of the traditional hill climber by elevating the feet, engaging the core and legs more effectively.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Obliques, Shoulders, Hip Flexors
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your feet elevated. Drive one knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs, alternating in a running motion while maintaining a stable plank.

Title: Holman Ninja Knee Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Ninja Knee Hill Climber is a variation of the hill climber that emphasizes agility and core strength by bringing the knees towards the chest in a quick motion.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position. Quickly bring one knee towards your chest, then switch to the other knee, focusing on speed and maintaining core engagement.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Shoulder Tap
Desc: Begin in a feet-elevated plank position with your feet on a bench or elevated surface. Engage your core and tap your left shoulder with your right hand, then return to plank. Alternate sides.
HowTo: Begin in a feet-elevated plank position with your feet on a bench or elevated surface. Engage your core, then tap your left shoulder with your right hand. Return to plank and alternate sides.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Hip Raise
Desc: Lie on your back with your feet elevated on a bench. Push through your heels to lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. Lower back down and repeat.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your feet elevated on a bench. Push through your heels to lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. Lower back down and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Holman Left Hand Right Foot Crab Reach
Desc: Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. Reach your left hand towards your right foot while lifting your hips, then return to the starting position and switch sides.
HowTo: Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. Lift your hips and reach your left hand towards your right foot. Return to the starting position and switch sides.

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up to Kicks
Desc: Begin in a crab position, flip your body to one side, perform a push-up, then kick your legs out in front of you. Alternate sides and repeat the sequence.
HowTo: Begin in a crab position. Flip your body to one side, perform a push-up, then kick your legs out in front of you. Alternate sides and repeat the sequence.

Title: Holman Right Hand Left Foot Sleeping Crab
Desc: Start in a crab position, lift your right hand and reach for your left foot while maintaining balance. Return to the starting position and switch sides.
HowTo: Start in a crab position. Lift your right hand and reach for your left foot while maintaining balance. Return to the starting position and switch sides.

Title: Holman Left Hand Right Foot Sleeping Crab
Desc: In a crab position, lift your left hand and reach for your right foot. Focus on maintaining stability and balance throughout the movement.
HowTo: In a crab position, lift your left hand and reach for your right foot. Focus on maintaining stability and balance throughout the movement.

Title: Holman Straight Plank with Alternating Leg Kick-Under
Desc: Begin in a straight plank position. Lift one leg and kick it under your body towards the opposite side while maintaining a strong core. Alternate legs.
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position. Lift one leg and kick it under your body towards the opposite side while maintaining a strong core. Alternate legs for the desired number of reps.

Title: Holman Right Hip Drop Push-Up
Desc: Start in a push-up position. Lower your body into a push-up, then drop your right hip towards the ground before returning to the starting position.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position. Lower your body into a push-up, then drop your right hip towards the ground before returning to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Holman Right Side Diagonal Burpee
Desc: The Holman Right Side Diagonal Burpee combines a burpee with a diagonal movement to engage the core and improve coordination. Start in a standing position, drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a plank, perform a push-up, jump your feet back to your hands, and then jump diagonally to the right.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a plank position, perform a push-up, jump your feet back to your hands, and then jump diagonally to the right.

Title: Holman Left Hip Drop Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Left Hip Drop Push-Up is a variation of the standard push-up that targets the chest and shoulders while engaging the obliques. Begin in a push-up position, lower your body, and as you push back up, drop your left hip towards the ground for added core activation.
HowTo: Begin in a push-up position. Lower your body towards the ground, and as you push back up, drop your left hip towards the ground to engage your obliques.

Title: Holman Right Leg 7-Up Crunch
Desc: The Holman Right Leg 7-Up Crunch is a core exercise that focuses on the abdominal muscles. Lie on your back with your right leg extended and left knee bent. Lift your shoulders off the ground while bringing your right leg up towards the ceiling, then lower back down.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your right leg extended and left knee bent. Lift your shoulders off the ground while bringing your right leg up towards the ceiling, then lower back down.

Title: Holman Left Leg 7-Up Crunch
Desc: The Holman Left Leg 7-Up Crunch targets the abs similarly to the right leg version. Lie on your back with your left leg extended and right knee bent. Crunch up, bringing your left leg towards the ceiling while engaging your core.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your left leg extended and right knee bent. Crunch up, bringing your left leg towards the ceiling while engaging your core.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Jack is a full-body exercise that combines a plank with a jumping jack motion. Start in a plank position and jump your feet out wide and then back together while maintaining a strong core and straight body.
HowTo: Start in a plank position. Jump your feet out wide and then back together while maintaining a strong core and a straight body.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Couch Hill Climber
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Couch Hill Climber is a dynamic exercise that targets the core and legs. With your feet elevated on a couch or platform, assume a plank position and alternate bringing your knees towards your chest in a running motion.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Transverse Abdominis, Hip Flexors
HowTo: With your feet elevated on a couch or platform, assume a plank position. Alternate bringing your knees towards your chest in a running motion.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Right Side Plank
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Right Side Plank is a variation of the side plank that increases the challenge by elevating the feet. Lie on your right side with feet elevated, lift your body into a side plank position, and hold while engaging your obliques.
HowTo: Lie on your right side with your feet elevated. Lift your body into a side plank position and hold while engaging your obliques.

Title: Holman Alternating Up-Down Plank to Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Alternating Up-Down Plank to Push-Up is a challenging exercise that works the upper body and core. Start in a plank position, lower one arm to a forearm plank, then return to a high plank, alternating arms with each repetition.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Transverse Abdominis, Shoulders, Chest
HowTo: Start in a plank position. Lower one arm to a forearm plank, then return to a high plank, alternating arms with each repetition.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Pike
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Pike is an exercise that targets the core, shoulders, and glutes. Begin in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. Engage your core and pike your hips up towards the ceiling while bringing your feet towards your hands. Return to the plank position and repeat.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Transverse Abdominis, Hip Flexors
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. Engage your core and pike your hips up towards the ceiling while bringing your feet towards your hands. Return to the plank position and repeat.

Title: Holman Ninja Knee Straight Plank
Desc: The Holman Ninja Knee Straight Plank is a dynamic core exercise. Start in a straight plank position. Bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg straight. Alternate sides while maintaining a strong plank position to engage the core and improve stability.
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position. Bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg straight. Alternate sides while maintaining a strong plank position to engage the core and improve stability.

Title: Holman Reverse Crunch to Hip Raise
Desc: The Holman Reverse Crunch to Hip Raise combines two movements for a comprehensive core workout. Start lying on your back with your knees bent. Perform a reverse crunch by lifting your hips off the ground, then extend your legs straight up into a hip raise. Lower back down and repeat.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Hip Flexors, Lower Back
HowTo: Start lying on your back with your knees bent. Perform a reverse crunch by lifting your hips off the ground, then extend your legs straight up into a hip raise. Lower back down and repeat.

Title: Holman Straight Plank Quick Reach
Desc: The Holman Straight Plank Quick Reach is an exercise that enhances stability and coordination. Begin in a straight plank position. Reach one arm forward quickly while maintaining your balance. Alternate arms and focus on keeping your hips stable throughout the movement.
HowTo: Begin in a straight plank position. Reach one arm forward quickly while maintaining your balance. Alternate arms and focus on keeping your hips stable throughout the movement.

Title: Holman Alternating Diagonal Straight Plank
Desc: The Holman Alternating Diagonal Straight Plank targets the core and improves balance. Start in a straight plank position. Reach one arm forward and the opposite leg back, creating a diagonal line. Return to plank and switch sides, maintaining a strong core throughout.
HowTo: Start in a straight plank position. Reach one arm forward and the opposite leg back, creating a diagonal line. Return to plank and switch sides, maintaining a strong core throughout.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Left Side Plank
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Left Side Plank is a variation of the side plank that increases difficulty. Elevate your feet on a bench or step while lying on your left side. Lift your hips off the ground, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Hold the position to strengthen the obliques.
HowTo: Elevate your feet on a bench or step while lying on your left side. Lift your hips off the ground, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Hold the position to strengthen the obliques.

Title: Holman Right Hand Left Foot Crab Reach
Desc: The Holman Right Hand Left Foot Crab Reach is a full-body exercise that enhances coordination and core stability. Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. Reach your right hand towards your left foot while lifting your hips off the ground. Alternate sides for a balanced workout.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Transverse Abdominis, Shoulders, Obliques
HowTo: Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. Reach your right hand towards your left foot while lifting your hips off the ground. Alternate sides for a balanced workout.

Title: Holman Low-Impact Crab Kick
Desc: The Holman Low-Impact Crab Kick is a gentle exercise that targets the core and improves mobility. Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. Slowly kick one leg out to the side while keeping your hips elevated. Alternate legs for a low-impact workout.
Muscles: Rectus Abdominis, Hip Flexors, Transverse Abdominis
HowTo: Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground. Slowly kick one leg out to the side while keeping your hips elevated. Alternate legs for a low-impact workout.

Title: Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up
Desc: The Holman Alternating Crab Flip to Froggy Push-Up is a dynamic exercise that combines a crab position with a flip and transitions into a froggy push-up. It targets the core, shoulders, and legs while enhancing coordination and strength.
HowTo: Start in a crab position with your hands behind you and feet flat on the ground. Flip your body to one side, transitioning into a froggy push-up position. Perform a push-up, then return to the crab position and repeat on the other side.

Title: Holman High-Impact Crab Kick
Desc: The Holman High-Impact Crab Kick is an energetic exercise performed from a crab position, where you kick your legs out alternately. This move engages the core, improves balance, and boosts cardiovascular fitness.
HowTo: Begin in a crab position. Alternate kicking your legs out in front of you while maintaining balance. Keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.

Title: Holman Single-Leg Right Pike
Desc: The Holman Single-Leg Right Pike involves balancing on one leg while raising the other leg into a pike position. This exercise strengthens the core, improves stability, and enhances flexibility.
HowTo: Stand on your right leg, lifting your left leg straight up into a pike position. Keep your core tight and balance on your right leg. Hold the position briefly before lowering your left leg back down.

Title: Holman Single-Leg Left Pike
Desc: The Holman Single-Leg Left Pike is similar to the right pike but performed on the left leg. It focuses on core strength, balance, and unilateral leg stability.
HowTo: Stand on your left leg, lifting your right leg straight up into a pike position. Maintain balance on your left leg while keeping your core engaged. Hold the position briefly before lowering your right leg back down.

Title: Holman Shoulder Tap to Hand Tap
Desc: The Holman Shoulder Tap to Hand Tap is a core-strengthening exercise that involves tapping your shoulder with the opposite hand while in a plank position, followed by a hand tap to the ground. It improves stability and coordination.
HowTo: Start in a plank position. Tap your left shoulder with your right hand, then return to plank. Next, tap your right hand to the ground. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Towel Reverse Plank Jack
Desc: The Holman Towel Reverse Plank Jack is performed in a reverse plank position using a towel for added resistance. This exercise targets the core, glutes, and shoulders while enhancing overall body strength.
HowTo: Begin in a reverse plank position with your feet on a towel. Engage your core and glutes, then perform a plank jack by sliding your feet out and back together while maintaining the plank position.

Title: Holman Side-to-Side Twist
Desc: The Holman Side-to-Side Twist is a rotational exercise that engages the core and obliques. It involves twisting the torso side to side while maintaining a stable lower body, improving flexibility and strength.
HowTo: Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly and twist your torso to the right, then to the left, while keeping your lower body stable. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Crab Kick with Hop
Desc: The Holman Crab Kick with Hop combines a crab kick with a hop, adding a plyometric element to the traditional crab kick. This exercise enhances cardiovascular fitness, coordination, and lower body strength.
HowTo: Start in a crab position. Perform a crab kick by extending one leg out while simultaneously hopping off the ground with the opposite foot. Alternate legs while maintaining a steady rhythm.

Title: Holman Crab Reach to Crab Kick
Desc: The Holman Crab Reach to Crab Kick is a dynamic exercise that combines a crab position with a reach and a kick, targeting core stability and mobility.
HowTo: Start in a crab position with your hands and feet on the ground, hips lifted. Reach one arm overhead while extending the opposite leg, then return to the starting position. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Wide Squat Side-to-Side Obliques
Desc: The Holman Wide Squat Side-to-Side Obliques involves performing a wide squat while engaging the oblique muscles through lateral movements, enhancing lower body strength and core engagement.
HowTo: Begin in a wide squat position. From there, shift your weight to one side while engaging your oblique muscles, then return to the center and shift to the other side. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Side Plank Crunch
Desc: The Holman Side Plank Crunch is an exercise that combines a side plank position with a crunch motion, focusing on strengthening the obliques and improving overall core stability.
HowTo: Start in a side plank position with your body in a straight line. Bring your top knee towards your chest while crunching your oblique muscles, then return to the starting position. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Total Fitness Ab Tuck
Desc: The hollow-body knee tuck is a bodyweight abdominal exercise performed on the floor. It is similar to both the hollow-body hold and the knee tuck or reverse crunch, combining elements of both. It primarily targets the muscles of the rectus abdominis, or “six-pack” muscles. It can be performed for reps or time, either as part of an ab-focused workout or as a component of a circuit workout.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest while simultaneously raising your upper body off the ground. Hold briefly, then lower back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Active hang from bar
Desc: The active hang from bar is a static exercise that involves isometrically squeezing the shoulders into the sockets and activating the muscles of the upper back and core. It can be used to improve pull-up form or to do more pull-ups, but also has postural and shoulder health benefits.
HowTo: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended. Squeeze your shoulder blades down and back, engaging your upper back and core. Hold this position for the desired duration.

Title: Cat-cow
Desc: Cat-cow is a traditional yoga pose that is also popular in fitness and strength training. It targets spinal mobility and control of the vertebral column. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a dynamic warm-up or as a mobility or restorative exercise anytime. It can also work as part of a yoga or bodyweight sequence with other poses.
HowTo: Start on all fours with your wrists under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Inhale as you arch your back and look up (cow position), then exhale as you round your back and tuck your chin (cat position). Repeat this flow for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Crab walk
Desc: The crab walk is a full-body exercise that has been popular in schools and gym classes for decades. It's a full-body coordination challenge that also burns serious calories, making it an excellent inclusion in a full-body warm-up or bodyweight circuit workout.
HowTo: Begin seated on the ground with your hands behind you and feet flat. Lift your hips off the ground and walk backward on your hands and feet, keeping your core engaged. Move forward and backward for the desired distance or time.

Title: Lunge with overhead reach
Desc: The lunge with overhead reach is a full-body bodyweight movement targeting the quads and shoulders. It has both strength and mobility benefits and can be performed one leg at a time or alternating for time or for reps.
HowTo: Stand tall and step forward into a lunge position with one leg while reaching both arms overhead. Push back to the starting position and alternate legs for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Hang from bar
Desc: The hang from bar is a static exercise that involves hanging from a bar by two hands. It can either be an "active hang," where you pack the shoulders and activate the muscles of the upper back, or a "passive hang," where you let the shoulders unpack and let the muscles of the upper body stretch. A passive hang may not be appropriate for all people depending on their shoulder health, but many coaches believe hanging can be healthy for the shoulders when done properly.
HowTo: To perform the hang from a bar, grip the bar with both hands shoulder-width apart. For an active hang, engage your shoulders by packing them down and activating your upper back muscles. For a passive hang, allow your shoulders to relax and stretch. Hold the position for the desired amount of time, ensuring your grip remains firm.

Title: Total Fitness Hollow Hold
Desc: The hollow-body hold is an isometric exercise that increases strength and stability in the core muscles. It is common in gymnastics training, CrossFit training, and as a core tension and bracing drill for lifters and athletes of all types. It is performed for time and can be performed as an activation drill prior to lifting, as part of a circuit, or as equipment-free core training anytime.
HowTo: To perform the hollow hold, lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight. Lift your arms, shoulders, and legs off the ground while keeping your lower back pressed into the floor. Hold this position, engaging your core, for the desired duration.

Title: Total Fitness Side Plank
Desc: The side plank is a popular isometric abdominal exercise focusing on the oblique muscles, as well as the transversus abdominis or deep core muscles. It is sometimes paired with the curl up and bird dog as the “McGill big three” for core strength and stability. It is performed for time and can work in a warm-up or in the core-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: To perform the side plank, lie on your side with your legs straight and stacked. Prop yourself up on your elbow, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Hold this position for the desired amount of time, engaging your obliques and core.

Title: Side plank pulse
Desc: The side plank pulse is a dynamic version of the side plank exercise focusing on the oblique muscles, as well as the transversus abdominis or deep core muscles. It can be performed for time or reps and can work in a warm-up or in the core-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: To perform the side plank pulse, start in a side plank position. From here, lower your hips slightly towards the ground and then lift them back to the starting position. Repeat this pulsing motion for the desired number of reps or time while maintaining a stable core.

Title: Total Fitness Spider Crawl (Unweighted)
Desc: The spider crawl is a bodyweight exercise that involves crawling on the floor with the knees outside of the elbows. It is different from a leopard crawl in that the hips are higher, and it's different from a bear crawl because the knees are wider. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, in short bursts for power or circuit training, or for longer durations as cardiovascular conditioning.
HowTo: To perform the spider crawl, start in a bear crawl position with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Crawl forward by moving your right hand and left foot simultaneously, keeping your knees outside your elbows. Alternate sides and continue crawling for the desired distance or duration.

Title: Total Fitness V-Up
Desc: The V-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It is similar to a suitcase crunch, but the lower back lifts off the ground at the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: To perform the V-up, lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. Simultaneously lift your upper body and legs off the ground, reaching your hands towards your feet to form a 'V' shape. Lower back down with control and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Knee-to-Elbow Mountain Climber
Desc: The MetaBurn Alternating Knee-to-Elbow Mountain Climber is a dynamic exercise that combines core stability and cardiovascular endurance. Start in a plank position, then alternately drive your knees towards your elbows in a controlled manner, engaging your core and maintaining proper form. This exercise helps improve agility, coordination, and overall fitness.
HowTo: To perform the MetaBurn Alternating Knee-to-Elbow Mountain Climber, start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. Drive your right knee towards your right elbow, then return to the plank position. Alternate legs, driving your left knee towards your left elbow. Continue alternating for the desired duration.

Title: Alternating sit-through with crunch-
Desc: The alternating sit-through with crunch is a full-body movement that starts in a bear crawl position and ends with a leg kicked out to the side. In between reps, you perform a crunch. It is commonly performed for reps or time in bodyweight circuits and animal-style flows, but can also work on its own or as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility sequence.
HowTo: To perform the alternating sit-through with crunch, start in a bear crawl position. Shift your weight to one side, extending the opposite leg out while performing a crunch by bringing your knee towards your chest. Return to the starting position and alternate sides for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: MetaBurn Alternating Toe-Touch
Desc: The MetaBurn Alternating Toe-Touch is an exercise that targets the core and hamstrings. Begin in a standing position, then reach down to touch your toes while alternating legs. Engage your core and maintain balance.
HowTo: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend at the hips to reach down towards your right toes, keeping your left leg straight. Return to standing and repeat on the left side, alternating between legs.

Title: MetaBurn Janda Sit-Up
Desc: The MetaBurn Janda Sit-Up is a variation of the traditional sit-up that emphasizes the hip flexors. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Perform a sit-up while keeping your feet elevated off the ground.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Elevate your feet off the ground. Engage your core and perform a sit-up, lifting your upper body towards your knees while keeping your feet elevated.

Title: MetaBurn Oblique Roll Crunch
Desc: The MetaBurn Oblique Roll Crunch focuses on the oblique muscles. Start lying on your back with your knees bent. As you crunch up, twist your torso to one side, engaging your obliques.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent. As you lift your upper body in a crunch, twist your torso to the right, engaging your right oblique. Lower back down and repeat, twisting to the left.

Title: MetaBurn Plank Jack
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank Jack is a dynamic plank variation that combines core stability with cardiovascular endurance. Start in a plank position and jump your feet out and in, similar to a jumping jack.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders and your body in a straight line. Jump your feet out wider than shoulder-width apart, then jump them back together, maintaining the plank position throughout.

Title: MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Side Plank
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank To Alternating Side Plank transitions between a standard plank and a side plank. Start in a plank position, then rotate to one side for a side plank, alternating sides.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with your body in a straight line. Rotate your body to the right, lifting your right arm towards the ceiling to form a side plank. Return to the plank position and repeat on the left side.

Title: MetaBurn Plank Up-Down
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank Up-Down is a core strengthening exercise that involves moving between a forearm plank and a high plank. Start in a forearm plank and push up to your hands, then return to the forearm position.
HowTo: Start in a forearm plank position with your elbows under your shoulders. Push up onto your hands to transition to a high plank, then lower back down to the forearm plank. Repeat this movement.

Title: MetaBurn Plank Wiper
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank Wiper targets the core and obliques. Begin in a plank position and rotate your hips to one side, then the other, mimicking a windshield wiper motion.
HowTo: Begin in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. Rotate your hips to the right, bringing your knees towards the right side, then return to the center and repeat on the left side, mimicking a windshield wiper motion.

Title: MetaBurn Plank With Alternating Toe-Touch
Desc: The MetaBurn Plank With Alternating Toe-Touch combines a plank with a reach to touch your toes. While in a plank position, lift one hand to touch the opposite foot, alternating sides.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your body in a straight line. Lift your right hand off the ground and reach it towards your left foot, then return to plank. Alternate sides, reaching your left hand towards your right foot.

Title: MetaBurn Plyo Push-Up
Desc: The MetaBurn Plyo Push-Up is a dynamic variation of the traditional push-up that incorporates explosive movement, targeting the chest, shoulders, and triceps while also engaging the core for stability.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position. Lower your body into a push-up, then explode upward, pushing off the ground. Land softly and immediately go into the next push-up.

Title: MetaBurn Psycho Crunch
Desc: The MetaBurn Psycho Crunch is an intense core exercise that combines a crunch with a twisting motion, engaging the abdominal muscles and obliques for improved strength and stability.
HowTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Perform a crunch while twisting your torso to one side, engaging your obliques. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Title: MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank
Desc: The MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank is a plank variation that focuses on retracting the shoulder blades, enhancing upper back strength and stability while engaging the core.
HowTo: Get into a plank position with your forearms on the ground. Focus on pulling your shoulder blades together and down while maintaining a strong core. Hold this position.

Title: MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank Hold
Desc: The MetaBurn Scapular Retraction Plank Hold is an isometric exercise that emphasizes maintaining a strong plank position while pulling the shoulder blades together, promoting shoulder stability and core engagement.
HowTo: Assume a plank position on your forearms. Pull your shoulder blades together and hold the position, ensuring your body remains in a straight line from head to heels.

Title: MetaBurn Scorpion
Desc: The MetaBurn Scorpion is a dynamic mobility exercise that involves rotating the hips and torso while lying on the ground, enhancing flexibility and core strength.
HowTo: Lie on your stomach with arms extended. Rotate your hips and torso to one side while keeping your shoulders on the ground. Alternate sides to enhance mobility.

Title: MetaBurn Side Crawler
Desc: The MetaBurn Side Crawler is a lateral movement exercise that challenges the core and shoulder stability while engaging the muscles of the hips and legs.
HowTo: Start in a plank position. Move laterally by bringing one hand and foot to the side, then follow with the other hand and foot, maintaining a stable core throughout.

Title: MetaBurn Side Plank Oblique Crunch
