After completing the hops, immediately transition into a forward sprint for a short distance. Repeat for the desired number of sets.

Title: Pop squat
Desc: The pop squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It is similar to a jump squat, but alternates between a narrow and wide stance with each jump. It can be performed for time or reps in power training and is also effective in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.
HowTo: Stand with your feet together. Lower into a squat position, then explosively jump up while spreading your legs wide and raising your arms overhead. Land softly and immediately go into the next squat, alternating between a narrow stance and a wide stance with each jump. Perform for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Star Jump
Desc: The Star Jump is a full-body plyometric exercise that involves jumping explosively while spreading your arms and legs out like a star. It helps improve power, coordination, and cardiovascular fitness.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees slightly and prepare to jump. Explode upward, spreading your arms and legs out to the sides as you jump. Land softly with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Side Lunge Touching Heel
Desc: The side lunge cross-body heel-touch is a lower-body exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. The heel-touch adds a slight rotational challenge.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Step to the side with one leg, bending that knee into a lunge while keeping the other leg straight. As you lunge, reach down to touch your opposite heel with the hand on the same side as the lunging leg. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Lying Prone Quadriceps
Desc: The Lying Prone Quadriceps exercise targets the quadriceps muscles. Lie face down on a mat, bend your knees, and bring your heels towards your glutes, then lower back down. This exercise helps strengthen the quads and improve flexibility.
HowTo: Lie face down on a mat with your legs extended. Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your glutes, squeezing your quadriceps at the top of the movement. Hold for a moment, then lower your legs back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Fast Kick With Arm Circles
Desc: The Fast Kick With Arm Circles is a dynamic exercise that combines kicking movements with arm circles to enhance coordination and flexibility. Stand tall, kick one leg forward while simultaneously making arm circles with your arms.
HowTo: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart. Kick one leg forward while simultaneously making large arm circles with your arms. Alternate legs and continue kicking and circling your arms for the desired duration. Focus on maintaining balance and coordination.

Title: Single-leg box squat
Desc: The single-leg box squat is a bodyweight exercise that targets the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It is similar in form to a pistol squat, except that you sit to a box. This allows you to customize the depth of the movement to your movement abilities and mobility level. For this reason, the single-leg box squat is a popular movement for building leg strength in beginning trainees. It can be performed in lower strength-focused rep ranges, such as 5-8 reps per leg, or for higher reps for muscle building.
HowTo: Stand in front of a box or bench. Lift one leg off the ground and lower your body into a squat, sitting back onto the box with the other leg. Make sure to keep your knee aligned with your toes. Pause briefly on the box, then push through your heel to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions on each leg.

Title: Defensive Slide
Desc: The Defensive Slide is a lateral movement exercise that mimics the defensive stance in sports. It involves sliding side to side in a low squat position to improve lateral movement, agility, and overall lower body strength.
HowTo: Start in a low squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart. Push off with one foot and slide laterally to the side, keeping your hips low and your knees bent. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Quick Leap
Desc: A dynamic exercise that involves jumping forward quickly and landing softly, focusing on explosive power and agility.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat. Explosively jump forward, extending your arms for momentum. Land softly on your feet, absorbing the impact with your knees slightly bent. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Vertical Mountain Climber
Desc: An intense cardio exercise that combines a plank position with alternating knee drives, simulating a mountain climbing motion.
HowTo: Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. Drive your right knee towards your chest, then return it to the starting position. Alternate legs, driving your left knee towards your chest. Keep your core engaged and maintain a steady pace.

Title: Reverse Burpee
Desc: A full-body movement that combines a squat and a jump, transitioning from a standing position to a burpee and back.
HowTo: Begin standing with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat, placing your hands on the ground. Jump your feet back into a plank position, perform a push-up if desired, then jump your feet back towards your hands. Explosively jump up, reaching your arms overhead. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Football Up-Down
Desc: A high-energy exercise that alternates between a squat and a push-up position, mimicking the movements of a football player.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Lower into a squat, placing your hands on the ground. Jump your feet back into a push-up position. Quickly jump your feet back towards your hands, then explode upwards into a jump. Land softly and repeat, alternating between the squat and push-up positions.

Title: Jump lunge heel kick
Desc: The jump lunge heel kick is a high-intensity, full-body exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It combines a jump lunge with a standing hamstring stretch in a unique combo that also challenges balance. It can be performed for time or reps as part of a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Step back into a lunge with your right leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground. Jump explosively from the lunge position, switching legs in mid-air. Land softly into a lunge on the opposite side. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Burpee box jump
Desc: The burpee box jump is an explosive bodyweight exercise that combines a burpee with a leap onto a box or step. First, you perform a traditional burpee, and then instead of jumping into the air, you jump onto a box. This makes you focus on power generation in the jump, making each rep more challenging. Burpee box jumps are often performed for high reps as part of metabolic conditioning circuits or workouts.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. Jump your feet back into a plank position. Perform a push-up if desired, then jump your feet back towards your hands. From the squat position, jump onto a box or step, landing softly. Step back down and repeat.

Title: Linear Depth Jump
Desc: A plyometric exercise that involves jumping off a platform and landing on a lower surface, focusing on depth and control.
HowTo: Stand on a platform with your feet shoulder-width apart. Step off the platform and land on a lower surface, focusing on absorbing the impact with your legs. Ensure your knees are slightly bent upon landing. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Slow Jog
Desc: A low-intensity exercise that involves a steady pace of jogging, ideal for warming up or recovery.
HowTo: Begin jogging at a slow, steady pace. Keep your arms relaxed at your sides or bent at the elbows. Focus on maintaining a consistent rhythm and breathing pattern. This exercise is ideal for warming up or for recovery after intense workouts.

Title: High knees
Desc: High knees is a full-body, cardio-based exercise with an emphasis on the lower body. It is often performed for reps or time as part of a dynamic warm-up.
HowTo: To perform high knees, stand with your feet hip-width apart. Begin jogging in place while lifting your knees as high as possible towards your chest, alternating legs quickly. Keep your core engaged and pump your arms to maintain momentum. Continue for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Jumping Jack
Desc: The jumping jack is a classic calisthenics exercise to improve overall conditioning. It’s one the most recognizable exercises on the planet, and it’s almost synonymous with training for military recruits. It can be done for time or reps, often in dynamic warm-ups or to mobilize the hips and shoulders.
HowTo: To perform a jumping jack, start standing with your feet together and arms at your sides. Jump up, spreading your legs shoulder-width apart while raising your arms overhead. Jump again to return to the starting position. Repeat for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Square Hop
Desc: The Square Hop is a dynamic exercise that involves hopping in a square pattern. It helps improve agility, coordination, and cardiovascular fitness. To perform this exercise, set up a square on the ground with four markers. Start at one corner, hop to the next corner, and continue around the square in a clockwise direction. Focus on landing softly and maintaining balance.
HowTo: To perform the square hop, set up four markers in a square shape. Start at one corner and hop to the next corner, landing softly. Continue hopping around the square in a clockwise direction, focusing on balance and coordination. Repeat for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Running lunge
Desc: The running lunge is a dynamic exercise that targets the lower body. It combines elements of a reverse lunge with a step-up, in that the front leg fully extends and the rear leg flexes up in front of the body. It targets a wide range of muscles in the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in any lower-body workout, or in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit.
HowTo: To perform a running lunge, start standing tall. Step forward with one leg into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee is over your ankle. Push off the front foot to return to standing and immediately step forward with the opposite leg into another lunge. Continue alternating legs for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: In-out jump squat
Desc: The in-out jump squat is a bodyweight squat variation that alternates wide and narrow jump squats. It targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings, and also provides a serious cardiovascular challenge. It can be performed for time or reps and is especially effective in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.
HowTo: To perform an in-out jump squat, start in a standing position. Jump out into a wide squat, then jump back to a narrow squat position. Ensure you land softly and maintain control. Repeat for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Gorilla squat
Desc: The gorilla squat is a bodyweight sequence that combines two reverse lunges and a bodyweight squat. It could also be performed with dumbbells, kettlebells, or other weights. It targets most of the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in the lower-body portion of any workout.
HowTo: To perform a gorilla squat, start in a standing position. Step back into a reverse lunge with one leg, then the other, followed by a squat. Return to standing and repeat the sequence. You can add weights for added resistance. Perform for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Burpee tuck jump
Desc: The burpee tuck jump is an explosive version of the burpee exercise that adds a tuck jump to the top of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.
HowTo: To perform a burpee tuck jump, start in a standing position. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground, then jump your feet back into a plank position. Perform a push-up (optional), then jump your feet back to your hands. Explode upwards into a tuck jump, bringing your knees towards your chest. Land softly and repeat for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Speed skater
Desc: The speed skater is an explosive version of the lateral lunge that involves jumping from side to side and landing on a single leg, then touching the ground. It challenges the lower-body muscles, including the quads, hips, and glutes, and the cardiovascular system, while training lateral movement.
HowTo: To perform a speed skater, start by standing on one leg. Jump laterally to the opposite side, landing on the other leg while bringing the opposite leg behind you. Touch the ground with your hand for balance if needed. Alternate sides quickly, focusing on explosive lateral movement. Repeat for a set time or number of repetitions.

Title: Jumping knee up-down
Desc: The jumping knee up-down is an explosive bodyweight movement that consists of a knee up-down followed by a jump squat. It targets the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings, but is also a challenging power and conditioning exercise.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Lower into a squat while bringing one knee up towards your chest. Jump explosively from the squat position, landing softly and immediately transitioning into the next repetition.

Title: Jump Lunge To Feet Jack
Desc: A dynamic exercise that combines a jump lunge with a feet jack, engaging the legs and core while improving cardiovascular fitness.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Step back into a lunge with one leg, then jump up and switch legs, landing in a lunge with the opposite leg. Follow this with a feet jack by jumping your feet out and back together.

Title: Reverse Lunge Rotation
Desc: An exercise that involves stepping back into a lunge while simultaneously rotating the torso, enhancing lower body strength and core stability.
HowTo: Stand tall, then step back with one leg into a lunge while rotating your torso towards the front leg. Return to standing and repeat on the other side.

Title: Alternating standing knee-pull stretch
Desc: The alternating standing knee-pull stretch targets range of motion in the hips, hamstrings, and lower back. It's a common movement in dynamic warm-ups for athletics or lower-body training, but can also be used to "limber up" for activity anytime.
Muscles: Quadriceps, Hamstrings, Hip Flexors, Lower Back
HowTo: Stand on one leg, pull the opposite knee towards your chest while balancing. Alternate legs in a controlled manner to stretch the hips and hamstrings.

Title: Seal jack
Desc: The seal jack is a variation on the jumping jack, one the most common calisthenic exercises on the planet. The difference between this movement and the jumping jack has to do with the arm motion. Instead of the arms coming together overhead, they come together in front of the body, like a seal clapping its fins.
HowTo: Stand with feet together. Jump up and spread your legs while bringing your arms together in front of your body, mimicking a seal clapping its fins. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Title: Kneeling quad thoracic stretch
Desc: The kneeling quad thoracic stretch is a stretch targeting greater range of motion in your thoracic spine. It is commonly included in dynamic warm-ups or cool-downs, but can also be performed as full-body mobility work any time.
HowTo: Kneel on one knee with the other foot in front. Reach your arm up and back while pushing your hips forward to stretch the quadriceps and thoracic spine. Switch sides.

Title: Single-Leg Squat With Knee Tap
Desc: The single-leg knee-tap squat is a single-leg squat variation that involves “floating” the back leg over the ground on the descent until touching just the knee to the ground or a pad. It is similar to a lunge, but without touching the back foot to the ground. It is an intense strength and coordination challenge that can work in any strength- or athleticism-focused workout.
HowTo: Stand on one leg and lower your body into a squat while extending the other leg behind you. Tap your knee to the ground or a pad before returning to the standing position.

Title: Shuttle run
Desc: The shuttle run is an athletic conditioning drill that’s great for developing speed and power, as well as changing direction. It’s a favorite of football and basketball players, but it can also be great conditioning work for lifters and athletes of all ability levels.
HowTo: Start at one end of a designated area. Sprint to the opposite end, touch the ground, and quickly turn to sprint back. Repeat for a set number of repetitions.

Title: Squat Isometric Hold
Desc: The hack squat is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the legs, particularly the quadriceps. It is often used as an accessory for squats, but can also be the main lower-body movement in a workout. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and knees behind your toes. Hold this position for a predetermined length of time.

Title: Wall sit
Desc: The wall sit is an exercise targeting the quadriceps and core muscle. It involves descending into a squat position while leaning against a wall, then holding that position for a predetermined length of time. It's a classic leg endurance-building exercise for basketball players and gymnasts.
HowTo: Stand with your back against a wall and slide down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, as if sitting in a chair. Keep your back flat against the wall and hold this position for a set amount of time.

Title: Walking lunge with hip extension
Desc: The walking lunge with hip extension is a combination of two movements, both targeting the lower body. The added hip extension places more of an emphasis on the glutes. It is a great inclusion in a dynamic warm-up for the lower body, but can also be performed for time or reps in any workout.
HowTo: Step forward with one leg into a lunge position, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle. As you return to standing, extend the same leg back and lift it behind you to engage the glutes. Alternate legs as you continue walking forward.

Title: Squat with alternating side leg raise
Desc: The squat with alternating side leg raise is a bodyweight version of the squat, but with a lateral leg lift to add extra focus to the abductor muscles. It can be performed for time or for reps as part of a dynamic warm-up for the lower body, or in any lower-body portion of a workout.
HowTo: Perform a squat by lowering your body as if sitting back into a chair. As you rise back up, lift one leg to the side, alternating legs with each squat.

Title: Lateral Squats
Desc: The lateral lunge is a lower-body bodyweight movement that works the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can also be performed holding dumbbells or other weights. It is often performed for reps as part of a dynamic warm-up or mobility routine but can also work in a circuit or other workouts.
HowTo: Step to the side into a lunge position, bending the knee of the stepping leg while keeping the other leg straight. Push back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Walking lunge with twist
Desc: The walking lunge with twist is an exercise that targets the lower body and the obliques. The twist not only works the obliques, it also opens up the thoracic spine. It is a great inclusion in a dynamic warm-up for a lower-body or full-body workout, but can also be performed for time or reps in any workout.
HowTo: Step forward into a lunge position, and as you lower your body, twist your torso towards the front leg. Return to standing and alternate legs as you continue.

Title: Boss Everline Backward Lunge Walk
Desc: The Boss Everline Backward Lunge Walk is an exercise that targets the glutes, hamstrings, and quads while improving balance and stability. To perform this exercise, step backward into a lunge position with one leg, keeping your front knee aligned over your ankle. Alternate legs as you walk backward, ensuring proper form and control.
HowTo: Step backward with one leg into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee is aligned over your ankle. Push back to standing and alternate legs as you walk backward.

Title: Reverse Diagonal Skaters
Desc: Reverse Diagonal Skaters are a dynamic exercise that enhances lateral movement and agility while targeting the legs and core. To perform this exercise, start in a standing position and leap to one side, landing on one foot while bringing the opposite leg behind you diagonally. Alternate sides in a skating motion, maintaining balance and engaging your core throughout the movement.
HowTo: Start in a standing position and leap to one side, landing on one foot while bringing the opposite leg behind you diagonally. Alternate sides in a skating motion, maintaining balance and engaging your core throughout the movement.

Title: FYR Air Squat
Desc: The bodyweight squat is a fundamental exercise that strengthens the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, for time or reps during a workout, or for hip and spine mobility any time.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up. Ensure your knees stay in line with your toes. Push through your heels to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: FYR Tuck Jump
Desc: The tuck jump is a vertical jump, an explosive lower-body exercise that is a common way to measure explosive hip and lower-body strength in athletes. The more explosive you are, the higher you'll be able to jump.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees and jump vertically, bringing your knees towards your chest at the peak of the jump. Land softly with your knees slightly bent and immediately go into the next jump. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Push-up sprawl tuck jump
Desc: The push-up sprawl tuck jump is an explosive bodyweight sequence that combines three movements: the push-up, the sprawl, and the tuck jump. It is similar to a burpee, but with a tuck jump at the top. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.
Muscles: Quadriceps, Glutes, Hamstrings, Chest, Shoulders, Core
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a push-up position and perform a push-up. Quickly jump your feet towards your hands into a squat position, then explosively jump up while tucking your knees towards your chest. Land softly and repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: FYR Running Lunge
Desc: The running lunge is a dynamic exercise that targets the lower body. It combines elements of a reverse lunge with a step-up, in that the front leg fully extends and the rear leg flexes up in front of the body. It targets a wide range of muscles in the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in any lower-body workout, or in a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Step back with one leg into a lunge, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle. Push through the front heel to return to standing, then switch legs and repeat. Perform for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: FYR Jumping Lunge
Desc: The alternating lunge jump is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets the lower-body muscles, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in power training, and is also effective in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Step forward into a lunge with one leg, then explosively jump up and switch legs in mid-air, landing in a lunge with the opposite leg forward. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: FYR Sprawl Frog Kick
Desc: The sprawl frog kick is an explosive bodyweight exercise that targets multiple muscle groups across the upper and lower body. It is similar to a traditional sprawl, but with an extra hop in the middle of each rep. It can be performed for time or reps in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit or workout.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Drop into a sprawl by kicking your feet back into a plank position. Quickly return to a squat position and perform a frog kick by jumping your feet towards your hands and then hopping back into the sprawl. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Jump squat-
Desc: The jump squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, hamstrings, and glutes. It is also a serious cardiovascular challenge when done for reps. It can be performed as a power exercise to build jumping power, or in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat and then jump explosively, reaching your arms overhead. Land softly with your knees slightly bent and immediately go into the next squat. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: FYR Sprinter Burpee
Desc: The FYR Sprinter Burpee is a high-intensity full-body exercise that combines a traditional burpee with a sprinting motion. Start in a standing position, drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a plank position, perform a push-up, return to the squat, and explosively jump up while driving your knees towards your chest as you sprint in place.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a squat and kick your feet back into a plank position. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands into a squat. Explosively jump up while driving your knees towards your chest and sprint in place. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: Single-leg burpee
Desc: The single-leg burpee is an advanced variation of the burpee exercise that involves performing all parts of the sequence with one leg at a time. It is usually performed alternating legs with each rep, but could be performed one side at a time. Performing one leg at a time increases the challenge to all parts of the body, especially the working leg, core, and shoulders.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position. 2. Shift your weight onto one leg and lower into a squat position. 3. Place your hands on the ground and kick your other leg back into a plank position. 4. Perform a push-up if desired. 5. Jump your feet back towards your hands. 6. Stand up and jump, switching legs in the air. 7. Land on the opposite leg and repeat.

Title: FYR Gorilla Squat
Desc: The gorilla squat is a bodyweight sequence that combines two reverse lunges and a bodyweight squat. It could also be performed with dumbbells, kettlebells, or other weights. It targets most of the muscles of the lower body, including the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed for time or reps in the lower-body portion of any workout.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Step back with your right leg into a reverse lunge. 3. Return to standing and immediately step back with your left leg into another reverse lunge. 4. Follow with a bodyweight squat. 5. Repeat the sequence for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Banded compass jump squat
Desc: The banded compass jump squat is an explosive squat variation performed with a band around the thighs just above the knees. This increases muscle activation in the hips and glutes, while the squat targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes. The landing for each jump is a 90-degree rotation from the starting position. The banded compass jump squat can be performed for low reps as a power-focused exercise, or for higher reps to build muscle in the lower body, challenge conditioning, and burn fat.
HowTo: 1. Place a resistance band around your thighs just above the knees. 2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. 3. Lower into a squat, then explosively jump up while rotating 90 degrees. 4. Land softly and immediately go into the next squat. 5. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Title: In-out sprawl
Desc: The in-out sprawl is a full-body movement that combines elements of a plank and a sprawl. It demands an explosive full-body jump from a plank position. It is a challenging move that trains balance, core strength, and many muscle groups, making it work well in a time-efficient bodyweight circuit workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Jump your feet towards your hands to enter a squat position. 3. Jump back to the plank position explosively. 4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Knee-tuck kick-up
Desc: The knee-tuck kick-up is a bodyweight movement that targets the muscles of the abs, the rectus abdominis or "six-pack" muscles in particular. It can be performed for time or reps in the ab-focused portion of any workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a seated position with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. 2. Place your hands behind you for support. 3. Tuck your knees towards your chest while leaning back slightly. 4. Extend your legs back out without touching the ground. 5. Repeat for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Bear crawl donkey kick
Desc: The bear crawl donkey kick is a more advanced version of the bear crawl exercise that adds a donkey kick. It adds an extra coordination and shoulder challenge to an already intense full-body movement that targets the cardiovascular system as well as a wide range of muscle groups, the shoulders, core, and legs in particular. It can be done as a full-body warm-up, in short bursts for power or circuit training, or for longer durations as cardiovascular conditioning.
HowTo: 1. Start in a bear crawl position on all fours. 2. Lift one leg and perform a donkey kick, extending your leg back and up. 3. Return to the bear crawl position and switch legs. 4. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Southpaw sprawl with push-up
Desc: The southpaw sprawl with push-up is a full-body movement that combines elements of a plank and a sprawl, with the addition of a push-up. It also has a rotational component, with a jumping leg-cross and torso twist in a straight-arm plank position. It is a challenging move that trains balance, core strength, and many muscle groups, making it work well in a time-efficient bodyweight circuit workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders. 2. Jump your feet out to the sides and then back together while performing a push-up. 3. As you jump your feet back together, twist your torso to one side. 4. Repeat the movement, alternating the side you twist towards for the desired number of reps.

Title: Bouncing lunge
Desc: The bouncing lunge is a bodyweight movement targeting the quads. It can be performed either for time or reps, and is often included as part of a fat-loss or athleticism-focused circuit workout.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet together. 2. Step forward into a lunge position with your right leg, keeping your left leg straight. 3. Push off your right foot and return to the starting position. 4. Immediately step forward into a lunge with your left leg. 5. Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps or time.

Title: Bodyweight Squat - Gethin Variation
Desc: The bodyweight squat is a fundamental exercise that strengthens the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, for time or reps during a workout, or for hip and spine mobility any time.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up. Go as low as you can while maintaining good form. Push through your heels to return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: FYR Alternating Lunge
Desc: The forward lunge is a lower-body bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can also be performed holding dumbbells or other weights. The forward lunge places more emphasis on the quads than other lunge variations. It can be performed for time or reps in the lower-body portion of any workout.
HowTo: Stand with your feet hip-width apart. Step forward with one leg into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee is directly above your ankle. Lower your back knee toward the ground without touching it. Push back to the starting position and alternate legs, repeating for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Bodyweight Walking Lunge - Gethin Variation
Desc: The walking lunge is a lower-body exercise that targets the glutes, quads, and hamstrings while challenging stability and balance. It can be performed for reps, time, or distance in the lower-body portion of any workout.
HowTo: Stand with your feet together. Step forward with one leg into a lunge, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle. Push off your front foot to return to the starting position and alternate legs, repeating for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Seated Quad Contraction
Desc: The Seated Quad Contraction is an exercise designed to strengthen the quadriceps muscles while seated. Sit on a chair with your back straight, feet flat on the floor. Contract your quadriceps by extending your knee and lifting your foot off the ground, holding the contraction for a few seconds before lowering it back down. Repeat for several repetitions.
HowTo: Sit on a chair with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Contract your quadriceps by extending one knee and lifting your foot off the ground. Hold the contraction for a few seconds, then lower your foot back down. Repeat for several repetitions on each leg.

Title: HM Squat with Alternating Leg Extension
Desc: The HM Squat with Alternating Leg Extension combines a squat with a leg extension to engage the lower body effectively. Start in a standing position, squat down while keeping your back straight. As you rise, extend one leg straight out in front of you, alternating legs with each repetition.
HowTo: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a squat while keeping your back straight. As you rise from the squat, extend one leg straight out in front of you. Alternate legs with each repetition and continue for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: HM Air Squat
Desc: The HM Air Squat is a bodyweight exercise that targets the legs and glutes. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up. Return to standing and repeat.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, keeping your chest up and your weight on your heels. Go as low as you can while maintaining good form, then push through your heels to return to standing. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: HM Alternating Jump Lunge
Desc: The HM Alternating Jump Lunge is a dynamic exercise that improves strength and coordination. Start in a lunge position with one leg forward. Jump up and switch legs mid-air, landing in a lunge with the opposite leg forward. Repeat this movement, alternating legs.
HowTo: Start in a lunge position with one leg forward. Jump up explosively, switching your legs mid-air so that you land in a lunge with the opposite leg forward. Continue to alternate legs with each jump for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: HM Alternating Lunge-In-Place
Desc: The HM Alternating Lunge-In-Place is a lower body exercise that targets the legs and glutes. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, step forward into a lunge with one leg, keeping your knee aligned with your ankle. Push back to the starting position and alternate legs, performing the lunges in place.
HowTo: Stand with your feet hip-width apart. Step forward with one leg into a lunge position, keeping your knee aligned with your ankle. Push back to the starting position and alternate legs, performing the lunges in place for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: HM Alternating Side Lunge
Desc: The HM Alternating Side Lunge is a lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. To perform this exercise, stand with your feet hip-width apart, step to the side with one leg, bending that knee while keeping the other leg straight. Push off the bent leg to return to the starting position and alternate sides.
HowTo: Stand with your feet hip-width apart. Step to the side with one leg, bending that knee while keeping the other leg straight. Push off the bent leg to return to the starting position. Alternate sides.

Title: HM Sumo Pulse
Desc: The HM Sumo Pulse is a variation of the sumo squat that emphasizes the inner thighs. Start in a wide stance with toes pointed out. Lower into a squat and pulse up and down in the squat position for a set number of repetitions, then return to standing.
HowTo: Start in a wide stance with your toes pointed out. Lower into a squat and pulse up and down in the squat position for a set number of repetitions. Return to standing.

Title: HM Sumo Squat
Desc: The HM Sumo Squat is a lower body exercise that targets the inner thighs, glutes, and quadriceps. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed out. Lower your body into a squat while keeping your chest up and back straight, then return to standing.
HowTo: Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed out. Lower your body into a squat while keeping your chest up and back straight. Return to standing.

Title: HM Alternating Side-Kick
Desc: The HM Alternating Side-Kick is a dynamic exercise that works the legs and core. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, lift one leg to the side in a kicking motion, alternating legs with each rep. Engage your core for stability.
HowTo: Stand with your feet hip-width apart. Lift one leg to the side in a kicking motion, alternating legs with each rep. Engage your core for stability.

Title: HM Tuck-Up Burpee
Desc: The HM Tuck-Up Burpee combines a burpee with a tuck-up for added core engagement. Start in a standing position, drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a plank, perform a push-up, return to squat, and then jump up while tucking your knees towards your chest.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a plank, perform a push-up, return to squat, and then jump up while tucking your knees towards your chest.

Title: HM Bear Crawl
Desc: The HM Bear Crawl is a full-body exercise that engages multiple muscle groups. Start on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Crawl forward by moving opposite hand and foot together, keeping your back flat and core engaged.
HowTo: Start on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Crawl forward by moving opposite hand and foot together, keeping your back flat and core engaged.

Title: HM Bear Stance Fire Hydrant
Desc: The HM Bear Stance Fire Hydrant targets the glutes and hips. Start in a bear crawl position, then lift one knee out to the side while keeping the foot flexed, mimicking a dog lifting its leg. Alternate sides.
HowTo: Start in a bear crawl position. Lift one knee out to the side while keeping the foot flexed, mimicking a dog lifting its leg. Alternate sides.

Title: HM Walking Frankenstein
Desc: The HM Walking Frankenstein is a dynamic stretch that warms up the hamstrings and improves flexibility. Walk forward while kicking one leg straight up in front of you, reaching for your toes with the opposite hand, alternating legs as you move.
HowTo: Walk forward while kicking one leg straight up in front of you, reaching for your toes with the opposite hand. Alternate legs as you move.

Title: HM Walking Hip Stretch
Desc: The HM Walking Hip Stretch is a dynamic stretch that targets the hip flexors and improves mobility. Stand tall and take a step forward, bending your front knee while keeping your back leg straight. Alternate legs to stretch both sides.
HowTo: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Take a step forward with your right leg, bending your right knee while keeping your left leg straight. Hold the stretch for a moment, then step back and repeat with your left leg. Continue alternating legs.

Title: HM Wide Jump Squat
Desc: The HM Wide Jump Squat is a powerful lower body exercise that combines a squat with a jump. Start in a squat position with feet wider than shoulder-width. Jump explosively, landing softly back into the squat position.
HowTo: Start in a squat position with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart. Push through your heels and jump explosively into the air. As you land, lower your body back into the squat position. Repeat for several repetitions.

Title: HM Boxer Shuffle
Desc: The HM Boxer Shuffle is a cardio exercise that mimics the footwork of a boxer. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and shift your weight from one foot to the other, lightly bouncing on your toes.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight to your right foot while lifting your left foot slightly off the ground. Quickly switch your weight to your left foot and lift your right foot. Continue to alternate sides while lightly bouncing on your toes.

Title: HM Running Lunge
Desc: The HM Running Lunge is a dynamic exercise that strengthens the legs and improves balance. Step forward into a lunge, alternating legs as you move forward, keeping your core engaged.
HowTo: Stand tall with feet together. Step forward with your right leg into a lunge, bending both knees to lower your body. Push back to the starting position and repeat with your left leg. Continue alternating legs while keeping your core engaged.

Title: HM Bulgarian Split Squat On Chair
Desc: The HM Bulgarian Split Squat On Chair is a strength exercise that targets the legs and glutes. Place one foot on a chair behind you and lower your body into a squat with the front leg, keeping your torso upright.
HowTo: Stand a few feet in front of a chair. Place your right foot on the chair behind you. Lower your body into a squat with your left leg, keeping your torso upright and your left knee aligned with your ankle. Push through your left heel to return to standing. Repeat on the other side.

Title: HM Burpee
Desc: The HM Burpee is a full-body exercise that combines a squat, push-up, and jump. Start standing, drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a push-up position, return to squat, and jump explosively.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. Kick your feet back into a push-up position. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands, returning to the squat position. Jump explosively into the air. Repeat for several repetitions.

Title: HM Butterfly
Desc: The HM Butterfly is a stretching exercise that opens up the hips. Sit on the floor with the soles of your feet together and gently press your knees down towards the ground.
HowTo: Sit on the floor with the soles of your feet together and your knees bent out to the sides. Hold your feet with your hands and gently press your knees down towards the ground to deepen the stretch. Hold for 15-30 seconds.

Title: HM Alternating Lunge Push-Up
Desc: The HM Alternating Lunge Push-Up combines strength training for the upper and lower body. Perform a push-up, then step forward into a lunge with one leg, alternating sides with each repetition.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position. Perform a push-up, then step your right foot forward into a lunge position. Return to the push-up position and repeat, stepping your left foot forward into a lunge. Continue alternating sides with each repetition.

Title: HM Comet
Desc: The HM Comet is a dynamic exercise that focuses on improving cardiovascular endurance and agility. It involves a series of quick movements that mimic a comet's trajectory.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Quickly move your feet in a series of quick steps, mimicking the trajectory of a comet. Incorporate lateral movements and changes in direction to enhance agility and cardiovascular endurance.

Title: HM Couch Stretch
Desc: The HM Couch Stretch is a flexibility exercise that targets the hip flexors and quadriceps. It involves kneeling on one knee with the other foot on a couch or elevated surface, allowing for a deep stretch.
HowTo: Kneel on one knee with the other foot resting on a couch or elevated surface. Keep your torso upright and push your hips forward to feel a deep stretch in the hip flexors and quadriceps. Hold the position for 20-30 seconds and switch legs.

Title: HM Down Up
Desc: The HM Down Up is a full-body movement that combines a squat and a push-up. It helps build strength and endurance by engaging multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Lower into a squat, then place your hands on the ground and kick your feet back into a push-up position. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands and return to standing.

Title: HM Duck Walk
Desc: The HM Duck Walk is a lower body exercise that strengthens the legs and improves mobility. It involves squatting low and walking forward while maintaining the squat position.
HowTo: Start in a squat position with your thighs parallel to the ground. Keep your back straight and core engaged. Begin walking forward while maintaining the squat position, taking small steps.

Title: HM Fragon
Desc: The HM Fragon is a unique exercise that combines elements of balance and strength. It typically involves holding a position while engaging core muscles.
HowTo: Stand on one leg and lift the other leg off the ground. Engage your core and hold the position for a few seconds. To increase difficulty, you can close your eyes or perform small movements with the raised leg.

Title: HM Frankenstein
Desc: The HM Frankenstein is a dynamic stretch that targets the hamstrings and hip flexors. It involves walking forward while kicking one leg straight out in front, alternating legs.
HowTo: Walk forward while kicking one leg straight out in front of you, alternating legs with each step. Keep your upper body straight and engage your core throughout the movement.

Title: HM Single-Leg Squat on Chair
Desc: The HM Single-Leg Squat on Chair is a strength exercise that targets the legs and core. It involves performing a squat on one leg while using a chair for support.
HowTo: Stand in front of a chair and lift one leg off the ground. Lower your body into a squat on the standing leg while keeping the other leg extended in front of you. Use the chair for balance if needed.

Title: HM Single-Leg Touchdown
Desc: The HM Single-Leg Touchdown is a balance and strength exercise that requires standing on one leg and reaching down to touch the ground, engaging the core and stabilizing muscles.
HowTo: Stand on one leg and hinge at the hips to reach down towards the ground with the opposite hand. Keep your standing leg slightly bent and engage your core to maintain balance. Return to standing and repeat.

Title: HM Speed Skater
Desc: The HM Speed Skater is a dynamic exercise that mimics the motion of speed skating. It involves lateral movements, engaging the legs, glutes, and core while improving balance and agility.
HowTo: Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart. Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat while keeping your chest up. Push off your feet to jump laterally to the right, landing softly back into a squat. Repeat the movement, alternating sides.

Title: HM Squat Jump
Desc: The HM Squat Jump is an explosive exercise that combines a squat with a jump. It targets the legs and glutes, enhancing power and strength while also providing a cardiovascular workout.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat, keeping your chest lifted and knees behind your toes. From the squat position, explode upward into a jump, reaching your arms overhead. Land softly back into the squat position and repeat.

Title: HM Squat Lunge
Desc: The HM Squat Lunge is a compound exercise that combines a squat and a lunge. It works the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes, improving lower body strength and stability.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat, then step one foot back into a lunge position. Return to the squat and repeat the lunge with the other leg. Continue alternating between the squat and lunge.

Title: HM Garland Pose
Desc: The HM Garland Pose is a yoga-inspired stretch that opens the hips and improves flexibility. It involves a deep squat position with hands in prayer, promoting balance and mindfulness.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a deep squat, keeping your back straight and chest lifted. Bring your hands together in front of your chest in a prayer position. Hold the position, focusing on your breath and maintaining balance.

Title: HM High Knees
Desc: The HM High Knees is a cardio exercise that involves running in place while lifting the knees high. It engages the core and legs, boosting heart rate and improving overall endurance.
HowTo: Stand tall and begin jogging in place. As you run, lift your knees high towards your chest while pumping your arms. Maintain a quick pace to elevate your heart rate and keep your core engaged.

Title: HM In-And-Out Squat
Desc: The HM In-And-Out Squat is a plyometric exercise that alternates between a squat and a jump outwards. It targets the legs and glutes while enhancing explosive power and coordination.
HowTo: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat, then jump outward, landing softly and returning to the squat position. Repeat the jump in and out, maintaining a steady rhythm.

Title: HM In-And-Out Squat Jump
Desc: The HM In-And-Out Squat Jump is a high-intensity exercise that combines squats with jumps in and out. It builds strength in the lower body and increases cardiovascular fitness.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Lower into a squat, then jump up and land with your feet together. Immediately jump out to a squat position again. Continue alternating between jumping in and out.

Title: HM Jumping Jack
Desc: The HM Jumping Jack is a classic aerobic exercise that involves jumping while spreading the arms and legs. It increases heart rate and improves coordination and agility.
HowTo: Stand with your feet together. Jump up while spreading your legs shoulder-width apart and raising your arms overhead. Jump again to return to the starting position. Repeat the movement in a continuous rhythm.

Title: HM Jumping Knee-Up
Desc: The HM Jumping Knee-Up is a dynamic exercise that targets the core and hip flexors. Begin in a standing position, jump up while bringing your knees towards your chest, and land softly before repeating.
HowTo: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Jump up while bringing your knees towards your chest, then land softly with your knees slightly bent. Repeat the movement.

Title: HM Jumping Rope
Desc: The HM Jumping Rope is a cardio exercise that improves coordination and endurance. Use a jump rope to perform continuous jumps, keeping your feet together and landing softly.
HowTo: Hold the jump rope handles in each hand. Jump continuously while keeping your feet together and landing softly on the balls of your feet. Maintain a steady rhythm.

Title: HM Right Calf-Spike Sumo Pulse
Desc: The HM Right Calf-Spike Sumo Pulse focuses on the lower body, particularly the calves and inner thighs. Start in a wide stance, lower into a sumo squat, and pulse while raising your right heel off the ground.
HowTo: Start in a wide stance with toes pointed slightly out. Lower into a sumo squat, keeping your back straight. Pulse in the squat position while raising your right heel off the ground, then lower and repeat.

Title: HM Reverse Lunge with Kick
Desc: The HM Reverse Lunge with Kick is a compound movement that strengthens the legs and glutes. Step back into a lunge, then kick forward with the same leg as you return to standing.
HowTo: Stand tall, then step back with your right leg into a lunge position. Lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Push through your front heel to return to standing and kick forward with the same leg.

Title: HM Left Knee-Up
Desc: The HM Left Knee-Up is an exercise that engages the core and hip flexors. Stand tall, lift your left knee towards your chest while balancing on your right leg, then lower and repeat.
HowTo: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Lift your left knee towards your chest while balancing on your right leg. Lower your left leg back down and repeat the movement.

Title: HM Left-Leg Lunge And Kick-Out
Desc: The HM Left-Leg Lunge And Kick-Out targets the legs and glutes. Step forward with your left leg into a lunge, then push off and kick your left leg out to the side before returning to standing.
HowTo: Stand tall and step forward with your left leg into a lunge position. Lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Push off your front foot and kick your left leg out to the side before returning to standing.

Title: HM Mountain Pose
Desc: The HM Mountain Pose is a foundational yoga pose that promotes stability and alignment. Stand tall with feet together, arms at your sides, and focus on your breath.
HowTo: Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides. Engage your core, relax your shoulders, and focus on your breath. Hold the pose for several deep breaths.

Title: HM Butt Kickers
Desc: The HM Butt Kickers is a cardio exercise that increases heart rate and warms up the legs. Jog in place while bringing your heels up towards your glutes.
HowTo: Jog in place while bringing your heels up towards your glutes. Keep your core engaged and maintain a steady pace to elevate your heart rate.

Title: HM Right-Leg Lunge And Kick-Out
Desc: The HM Right-Leg Lunge And Kick-Out is an exercise that targets the legs and glutes. Begin in a standing position, step back with your right leg into a lunge while keeping your left knee aligned over your ankle. Push through your left heel to return to standing, then kick your right leg out to the side. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a standing position. 2. Step back with your right leg into a lunge, keeping your left knee aligned over your ankle. 3. Push through your left heel to return to standing. 4. Kick your right leg out to the side. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: HM Sumo Get-Up
Desc: The HM Sumo Get-Up is a full-body exercise that combines a sumo squat with a standing movement. Start in a wide stance with toes pointed out. Lower into a squat, keeping your chest up, then push through your heels to stand up while bringing one arm overhead. Alternate sides for a balanced workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a wide stance with toes pointed out. 2. Lower into a squat, keeping your chest up. 3. Push through your heels to stand up while bringing one arm overhead. 4. Alternate sides for a balanced workout.

Title: AM Jump Squat
Desc: The jump squat is an explosive bodyweight exercise targeting the quads, hamstrings, and glutes. It is also a serious cardiovascular challenge when done for reps. It can be performed as a power exercise to build jumping power, or in any fat-loss or athleticism-focused workout.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower into a squat position. 3. Explode upward, jumping as high as you can. 4. Land softly back into the squat position. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: AM Bodyweight Squat
Desc: The bodyweight squat is a fundamental exercise that strengthens the quads, glutes, and hamstrings. It can be performed as part of a dynamic warm-up, for time or reps during a workout, or for hip and spine mobility any time.
HowTo: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower your body by bending your knees, keeping your chest up and back straight. 3. Go down until your thighs are parallel to the ground. 4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: High knees sprawl drill
Desc: The high knees sprawl drill is a full-body, cardio and strength-focused exercise. It can be performed for reps or time in a fast-paced circuit or other workout.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position. 2. Drive your knees up towards your chest rapidly while simultaneously performing a sprawl by dropping your hands to the ground and kicking your legs back. 3. Quickly return to the standing position and repeat for reps or time.

Title: UP Bulgarian Split Squat
Desc: The dumbbell Bulgaria split squat is a single-leg exercise targeting the quads, glutes, and hamstrings.
HowTo: 1. Stand a few feet in front of a bench or elevated surface. 2. Place one foot on the bench behind you. 3. Lower your body into a lunge position with your front knee over your ankle. 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.

Title: UN Forward Lunge
Desc: The UN Forward Lunge is a dynamic lower body exercise that enhances strength and stability. Start by standing tall, then step forward with one leg into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee does not extend past your toes. Push back to the starting position and alternate legs.
HowTo: 1. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart. 2. Step forward with one leg into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee does not extend past your toes. 3. Push back to the starting position. 4. Alternate legs and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: UN Front Foot Elevated Split Squat
Desc: The UN Front Foot Elevated Split Squat is an advanced lower body exercise that targets the quads and glutes. Stand in front of a bench or elevated surface, place one foot on it, and lower your body into a split squat position. Keep your torso upright and push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
HowTo: 1. Stand in front of a bench or elevated surface. 2. Place one foot on the bench behind you. 3. Lower your body into a split squat position, keeping your torso upright. 4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position. 5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.

Title: UNS Half-Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
Desc: The UNS Half-Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch is a mobility exercise designed to stretch the hip flexors and improve flexibility. Start in a half-kneeling position with one knee on the ground and the other foot in front, ensuring the front knee is at a 90-degree angle. Gently push your hips forward while keeping your torso upright to feel a stretch in the hip of the back leg. Hold for 20-30 seconds and switch sides.
HowTo: Start in a half-kneeling position with one knee on the ground and the other foot in front, ensuring the front knee is at a 90-degree angle. Gently push your hips forward while keeping your torso upright to feel a stretch in the hip of the back leg. Hold for 20-30 seconds and switch sides.

Title: UNS Low Depth Jump
Desc: The UNS Low Depth Jump is a plyometric exercise aimed at developing explosive power and strength in the lower body. Stand on a low platform and step off, landing softly on the ground with your knees slightly bent. Immediately jump as high as possible upon landing. Focus on maintaining good form and minimizing ground contact time.
HowTo: Stand on a low platform and step off, landing softly on the ground with your knees slightly bent. Immediately jump as high as possible upon landing, focusing on maintaining good form and minimizing ground contact time.

Title: UNS Forward-To-Reverse Lunge
Desc: The UNS Forward-To-Reverse Lunge is a dynamic exercise that targets the legs and glutes while improving balance and coordination. Start by stepping forward into a lunge with one leg, ensuring the knee does not extend past the toes. Push back to the starting position and immediately step back into a reverse lunge with the same leg. Alternate legs for a complete set.
HowTo: Start by stepping forward into a lunge with one leg, ensuring the knee does not extend past the toes. Push back to the starting position and immediately step back into a reverse lunge with the same leg. Alternate legs for a complete set.

Title: Holman Towel Squat Thrust
Desc: The Holman Towel Squat Thrust is a full-body exercise that combines a squat and a thrust movement using a towel for added resistance. Begin in a standing position holding a towel with both hands. Squat down while keeping the towel taut, then thrust it forward as you jump back into a plank position. Reverse the movement to return to standing.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position holding a towel with both hands. Squat down while keeping the towel taut, then thrust it forward as you jump back into a plank position. Reverse the movement to return to standing.

Title: Holman Towel Alternating Prisoner Squat
Desc: The Holman Towel Alternating Prisoner Squat is a lower body exercise that engages the legs and core while incorporating a towel for resistance. Hold the towel behind your head with both hands. Perform a squat while alternating lifting one leg out to the side. Ensure your knees stay aligned with your toes and your chest remains lifted throughout the movement.
HowTo: Hold the towel behind your head with both hands. Perform a squat while alternating lifting one leg out to the side. Ensure your knees stay aligned with your toes and your chest remains lifted throughout the movement.

Title: Holman Towel Alternating Lateral Lunge
Desc: The Holman Towel Alternating Lateral Lunge is a lateral movement exercise that targets the inner and outer thighs. Hold a towel with both hands in front of you. Step out to the side into a lateral lunge, keeping the opposite leg straight. Push back to the center and alternate to the other side. Maintain good posture and control during the movement.
HowTo: Hold a towel with both hands in front of you. Step out to the side into a lateral lunge, keeping the opposite leg straight. Push back to the center and alternate to the other side, maintaining good posture and control during the movement.

Title: Holman Squat Pull-Through Jump
Desc: The Holman Squat Pull-Through Jump is a plyometric exercise that develops lower body power and explosiveness. Start in a squat position with a towel or resistance band between your legs. As you squat down, pull the towel through your legs, then explode upwards into a jump. Land softly and repeat the movement.
HowTo: Start in a squat position with a towel or resistance band between your legs. As you squat down, pull the towel through your legs, then explode upwards into a jump. Land softly and repeat the movement.

Title: Holman 180 Jump
Desc: The Holman 180 Jump is a dynamic plyometric exercise that enhances agility and coordination. Begin in a standing position, then jump 180 degrees to turn and land facing the opposite direction. Focus on landing softly with your knees slightly bent to absorb the impact. Repeat the jumps for a set number of repetitions.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position, then jump 180 degrees to turn and land facing the opposite direction. Focus on landing softly with your knees slightly bent to absorb the impact. Repeat the jumps for a set number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Foot-Elevated Knee-Up to Squat
Desc: The Holman Foot-Elevated Knee-Up to Squat is an exercise that combines a knee-up movement while your feet are elevated, transitioning into a squat. This targets the core, quads, and glutes.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position with your feet elevated on a surface. 2. Engage your core and lift one knee towards your chest. 3. Transition smoothly into a squat position, lowering your hips back and down. 4. Push through your heels to return to standing and repeat.

Title: Holman Feet-Elevated Squat Thrust
Desc: The Holman Feet-Elevated Squat Thrust is a dynamic exercise that involves thrusting your body forward from a squat position while your feet are elevated, enhancing cardiovascular fitness and strength.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a squat position with your feet elevated. 2. Thrust your body forward, extending your legs and landing back in a squat. 3. Repeat the thrusting motion, focusing on maintaining an elevated position with your feet.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Lunge Jump
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Lunge Jump is an explosive exercise where you perform a lunge with your hands elevated, jumping to switch legs, which builds lower body strength and power.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position with your hands elevated on a surface. 2. Step one foot back into a lunge while keeping your hands elevated. 3. Jump to switch legs, landing in a lunge position on the opposite side. 4. Repeat the jumping lunge motion.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Jack to Split Jump
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Jack to Split Jump combines a jumping jack motion with a split jump while your hands are elevated, improving agility and coordination.
HowTo: 1. Begin with your hands elevated and feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Perform a jumping jack by jumping out to the sides while raising your arms overhead. 3. Transition immediately into a split jump by jumping and landing with one foot forward and the other back. 4. Repeat the sequence.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Wide Squat Thrust
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Wide Squat Thrust is a variation of the squat thrust where your hands are elevated, focusing on wider stance squats to engage the inner thighs and glutes.
HowTo: 1. Start in a standing position with your hands elevated. 2. Step your feet wide apart into a squat position, keeping your hands elevated. 3. Perform a squat thrust by lowering your hands and jumping your feet back into a plank position. 4. Return to the wide squat and repeat.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Squat Thrust to Split Jack
Desc: The Holman Hands-Elevated Squat Thrust to Split Jack is a compound exercise that transitions from a squat thrust to a split jack, enhancing strength and cardiovascular endurance.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a squat thrust position with hands elevated. 2. Perform a squat thrust by jumping your feet back into a plank. 3. Transition into a split jack by jumping your feet out to the sides and then back together. 4. Return to the squat thrust and repeat.

Title: Holman Squat Jump
Desc: The Holman Squat Jump is a plyometric exercise that involves jumping explosively from a squat position, targeting the legs and improving explosive power.
HowTo: 1. Start in a squat position with feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Engage your core and jump explosively upwards from the squat. 3. Land softly back into the squat position. 4. Repeat the jump for the desired number of repetitions.

Title: Holman Squat Pulse
Desc: The Holman Squat Pulse is a lower body exercise where you perform small pulsing movements at the bottom of a squat, focusing on endurance and muscle engagement in the legs.
HowTo: 1. Begin in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart. 2. Lower into the squat and hold at the bottom. 3. Perform small pulsing movements up and down without fully standing. 4. Continue pulsing for the desired duration.

Title: Holman Jump-Out Push-Up
Desc: Start in a push-up position. Jump your feet towards your hands, then jump back to the push-up position. Repeat.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position. Jump your feet towards your hands, then jump back to the push-up position. Repeat.

Title: Holman Alternating Forward Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle. Alternate legs.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle. Alternate legs.

Title: Holman Burpee to Jump
Desc: Begin in a standing position. Drop into a squat, place your hands on the ground, kick your feet back into a push-up position, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back to your hands and jump up.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Drop into a squat, place your hands on the ground, kick your feet back into a push-up position, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back to your hands and jump up.

Title: Holman Pilates Single-Leg Stretch
Desc: Lie on your back with one leg extended and the other bent. Inhale as you pull the bent knee towards your chest while extending the other leg, then switch legs.
HowTo: Lie on your back with one leg extended and the other bent. Inhale as you pull the bent knee towards your chest while extending the other leg, then switch legs.

Title: Holman Alternating Reverse Prisoner Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Step back with one leg into a lunge position while keeping your hands behind your head. Alternate legs.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Step back with one leg into a lunge position while keeping your hands behind your head. Alternate legs.

Title: Holman Narrow-Wide Squat Jump to 180 Jump
Desc: Start in a squat position with feet shoulder-width apart. Jump up, spreading your legs wide and then landing back in a squat. Immediately jump 180 degrees to face the opposite direction.
HowTo: Start in a squat position with feet shoulder-width apart. Jump up, spreading your legs wide and then landing back in a squat. Immediately jump 180 degrees to face the opposite direction.

Title: Holman 180 Jump to Lunge
Desc: Stand with feet together. Jump and turn 180 degrees while landing in a lunge position with one leg forward. Alternate sides.
HowTo: Stand with feet together. Jump and turn 180 degrees while landing in a lunge position with one leg forward. Alternate sides.

Title: Holman Imaginary Jump Rope
Desc: Stand with feet together. Mimic the motion of jumping rope by hopping on your feet while swinging your arms as if holding a rope.
HowTo: Stand with feet together. Mimic the motion of jumping rope by hopping on your feet while swinging your arms as if holding a rope.

Title: Holman Fast Feet with Hands Up
Desc: A dynamic exercise focusing on foot speed and agility, performed with hands raised to engage the upper body.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands raised. Quickly lift one foot off the ground and alternate feet while moving in place, focusing on speed and agility.

Title: Holman Hands-Elevated Alternating Lunge Jump
Desc: An explosive lower body exercise that combines a lunge and a jump, with hands elevated to increase difficulty and stability.
HowTo: Start in a standing position with hands elevated. Step back into a lunge with one leg, then explosively jump up, switching legs in mid-air, landing softly into the next lunge.

Title: Holman Right Split Lunge
Desc: A strength and balance exercise targeting the legs, performed by stepping back into a split lunge position.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Step back with your right leg into a lunge, keeping your front knee over your ankle. Push through your front heel to return to standing.

Title: Holman Left Split Lunge
Desc: A variation of the split lunge focusing on the left leg, enhancing leg strength and stability.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Step back with your left leg into a lunge, ensuring your front knee is aligned with your ankle. Push through your front heel to return to standing.

Title: Holman Plyometric Jump
Desc: A high-intensity plyometric exercise that involves jumping explosively from a standing position.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees slightly and jump explosively into the air, reaching your arms overhead, then land softly.

Title: Holman Quad Touch Jump
Desc: An explosive jump where the athlete touches the ground with their quads before jumping back up.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Squat down and touch your quads with your hands, then jump explosively into the air, reaching your arms overhead.

Title: Holman Skate
Desc: A lateral movement exercise that mimics skating, focusing on balance and leg strength.
HowTo: Stand on one leg and push off laterally, landing on the opposite leg. Repeat the motion side to side, focusing on balance and control.

Title: Holman Lunge Jump
Desc: A powerful exercise combining a lunge and a jump to develop lower body strength and explosive power.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Step forward into a lunge, then jump explosively, switching legs in mid-air and landing softly into a lunge with the opposite leg.

Title: Holman Flying Squat Thrust
Desc: The Holman Flying Squat Thrust combines a squat thrust with a flying motion, engaging the core and legs while improving explosive power.
HowTo: Start in a standing position, drop into a squat thrust by placing your hands on the ground and jumping your feet back into a plank position. Quickly return your feet to your hands and jump upwards, engaging your core and legs.

Title: Holman 90-Degree Jump
Desc: The Holman 90-Degree Jump involves jumping 90 degrees to the side, enhancing agility and lateral strength.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees slightly and jump to the side, rotating your body 90 degrees while landing softly on the balls of your feet.

Title: Holman Half Jack to 180 Jump
Desc: The Holman Half Jack to 180 Jump is a dynamic exercise that transitions from a half jumping jack to a 180-degree jump, focusing on coordination and balance.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Perform a half jumping jack by raising your arms and jumping out to the side. Immediately transition into a 180-degree jump, turning your body to face the opposite direction.

Title: Holman Quick Feet to Quad Touch Jump
Desc: The Holman Quick Feet to Quad Touch Jump emphasizes quick foot movements followed by a jump to touch the quads, improving speed and agility.
HowTo: Stand with your feet hip-width apart. Quickly move your feet in place as if running, then jump and touch your quads with your hands before landing softly.

Title: Holman Squat Thrust to Push-Up to Super Woman
Desc: The Holman Squat Thrust to Push-Up to Super Woman is a compound exercise that combines a squat thrust, a push-up, and a superwoman extension, targeting multiple muscle groups.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a squat thrust, then perform a push-up. After the push-up, extend your arms and legs out in a superwoman position before returning to the starting position.

Title: Holman Plyometric Jump to 180 Jump
Desc: The Holman Plyometric Jump to 180 Jump focuses on explosive power through a plyometric jump followed by a 180-degree turn, enhancing agility.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Perform a plyometric jump, landing softly, and immediately rotate your body 180 degrees in the air before landing.

Title: Holman Standing Heel Click to Hands Down Heel Click
Desc: The Holman Standing Heel Click to Hands Down Heel Click is a rhythmic exercise that combines heel clicks while standing and bending down, improving coordination and flexibility.
HowTo: Stand upright and jump while clicking your heels together. Bend down to touch the ground and perform another heel click while in the bent position.

Title: Holman Burpee to 180 Jump
Desc: The Holman Burpee to 180 Jump is a high-intensity exercise that combines a burpee with a 180-degree jump, boosting cardiovascular fitness and strength.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Drop into a burpee by squatting down, placing your hands on the ground, and jumping your feet back into a plank. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back to your hands and explosively jump 180 degrees.

Title: Holman Traveling Low Jack to Belly Touch
Desc: Begin in a low jack position with feet together. Jump feet out to the sides while raising arms overhead, then return to the starting position. Transition to a belly touch by lowering your body and touching your chest to the ground before returning to the starting position.
HowTo: Begin in a low jack position with feet together. Jump feet out to the sides while raising arms overhead, then return to the starting position. Lower your body to touch your chest to the ground before returning to the starting position.

Title: Holman Flying Squat Thrust to Shoulder Tap
Desc: Start in a standing position. Perform a squat and place your hands on the ground. Jump your feet back into a plank position. Perform a shoulder tap by lifting one hand to touch the opposite shoulder, then return to a squat and repeat.
HowTo: Start in a standing position. Perform a squat and place your hands on the ground. Jump your feet back into a plank position. Lift one hand to touch the opposite shoulder, then return to a squat and repeat.

Title: Holman Squat Jump to Alternating Side Lunge Jump
Desc: Begin in a squat position. Jump explosively upward and land softly into a squat. From the squat, jump to the side into a lunge position, alternating sides with each jump.
HowTo: Begin in a squat position. Jump explosively upward and land softly back into a squat. From the squat, jump to the side into a lunge position, alternating sides with each jump.

Title: Holman Low Squat with Low Diagonal Dumbbell Punch
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding dumbbells. Lower into a squat while punching diagonally with one arm. Alternate arms with each squat, maintaining a low position.
HowTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding dumbbells. Lower into a squat while punching diagonally with one arm. Alternate arms with each squat, maintaining a low position.

Title: Holman Right Leg Hop to Right Reverse Lunge
Desc: Start standing on your right leg. Hop forward and land softly, then transition into a reverse lunge with the right leg stepping back. Repeat the hop and lunge sequence.
HowTo: Start standing on your right leg. Hop forward and land softly, then transition into a reverse lunge with the right leg stepping back. Repeat the hop and lunge sequence.

Title: Holman Left Leg Hop to Left Reverse Lunge
Desc: Begin standing on your left leg. Perform a hop forward, landing softly, and then step back into a reverse lunge with the left leg. Alternate between hopping and lunging.
HowTo: Begin standing on your left leg. Perform a hop forward, landing softly, and then step back into a reverse lunge with the left leg. Alternate between hopping and lunging.

Title: Holman Burpee to Open Stance
Desc: Begin in a standing position. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. Jump back into a plank position, then jump forward into an open stance and stand up.
HowTo: Begin in a standing position. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. Jump back into a plank position, then jump forward into an open stance and stand up.

Title: Holman Diagonal Squat Thrust to Renegade Forward Punch
