HowTo: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grasp the cable handle with a reverse grip (palms facing up). Keep your elbow close to your body and push the handle down until your arm is fully extended. Slowly return to the starting position, focusing on engaging the triceps.

Title: 30 Arms Cable V-Bar Push-Down
Desc: The 30 Arms Cable V-Bar Push-Down is a triceps exercise that uses a V-bar attachment on a cable machine. It focuses on the triceps by pushing down with both hands, allowing for a natural hand position and maximizing muscle activation.
HowTo: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grasp the V-bar attachment with both hands, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the V-bar down until your arms are fully extended, then return to the starting position in a controlled manner.

Title: 30 Arms Cable Straight-Bar Push-Down
Desc: The 30 Arms Cable Straight-Bar Push-Down is a fundamental triceps exercise performed on a cable machine. It involves pushing down a straight bar, effectively targeting the triceps while maintaining proper form.
HowTo: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grasp the straight bar with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended, then slowly return to the starting position, ensuring proper form throughout.

Title: 30 Arms Cable Rope Push-Down
Desc: The 30 Arms Cable Rope Push-Down is a popular triceps exercise that utilizes a rope attachment on a cable machine. It allows for a full range of motion and emphasizes the outer triceps during the push-down movement.
HowTo: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grasp the rope attachment with both hands, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the rope down while spreading the ends apart at the bottom of the movement, then return to the starting position in a controlled manner.

Title: 30 Arms Cable Rope Overhead Triceps Extension
Desc: The 30 Arms Cable Rope Overhead Triceps Extension is an effective exercise for targeting the triceps. By extending the rope overhead, it engages the long head of the triceps, promoting strength and muscle growth.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, grasp the rope attachment and extend it overhead. Keeping your elbows close to your head, lower the rope behind your head until your arms are at a 90-degree angle. Extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on engaging the triceps.

Title: BFR underhand straight-bar push-down
Desc: The blood flow restriction (BFR) underhand straight-bar push-down is an arm movement that builds triceps size and strength using a cable stack, straight-bar grip, and blood flow restriction bands. It is popular in high-rep "pump"-style arm workouts. The bands should be placed as high as possible on your arms, at a tightness of no greater than 8 on a scale of 10. Most BFR workouts recommend using a far lighter weight than usual, perhaps as low as 25-50 percent of a normal working weight.
HowTo: Attach the blood flow restriction bands to your upper arms, ensuring they are tight but not overly constrictive. Stand facing the cable machine and grasp the straight bar with an underhand grip. Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended, then slowly return to the starting position. Use a lighter weight than usual, around 25-50% of your normal working weight.

Title: BFR overhand straight-bar push-down
Desc: The blood flow restriction (BFR) overhand straight-bar push-down is an arm movement that builds triceps size and strength using a cable stack, straight-bar grip, and blood flow restriction bands. It is popular in high-rep "pump"-style arm workouts. The bands should be placed as high as possible on your arms, at a tightness of no greater than 8 on a scale of 10. Most BFR workouts recommend using a far lighter weight than usual, perhaps as low as 25-50 percent of a normal working weight.
HowTo: 1. Set up the cable machine with a straight bar attachment. 2. Adjust the weight to a lighter load (25-50% of your normal working weight). 3. Place the blood flow restriction bands high on your arms, ensuring they are tight but not exceeding a tightness of 8 on a scale of 10. 4. Stand facing the machine and grasp the straight bar with both hands. 5. Keeping your elbows close to your body, press the bar down until your arms are fully extended. 6. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for high reps.

Title: BFR cable rope push-down
Desc: The blood flow restriction (BFR) cable rope push-down is an arm movement that builds triceps size and strength using a cable stack, rope grip, and blood flow restriction bands. It is popular in high-rep "pump"-style arm workouts. The bands should be placed as high as possible on your arms, at a tightness of no greater than 8 on a scale of 10. Most BFR workouts recommend using a far lighter weight than usual, perhaps as low as 25-50 percent of a normal working weight.
HowTo: 1. Set up the cable machine with a rope attachment. 2. Adjust the weight to a lighter load (25-50% of your normal working weight). 3. Place the blood flow restriction bands high on your arms, ensuring they are tight but not exceeding a tightness of 8 on a scale of 10. 4. Stand facing the machine and grasp the rope with both hands. 5. Keeping your elbows close to your body, press the rope down until your arms are fully extended. 6. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for high reps.

Title: Triceps Pressdown
Desc: The Triceps Pressdown is an isolation exercise targeting the triceps muscles. It is typically performed using a cable machine with a straight bar or rope attachment. Stand facing the machine, grasp the bar or rope with both hands, and press down until your arms are fully extended. This exercise helps to build strength and definition in the triceps.
HowTo: 1. Set up the cable machine with either a straight bar or rope attachment. 2. Adjust the weight to your desired level. 3. Stand facing the machine and grasp the bar or rope with both hands. 4. Keeping your elbows close to your body, press down until your arms are fully extended. 5. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Machine Triceps Extension
Desc: The machine triceps extension is an isolation exercise targeting the tricep muscles.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the machine and adjust the seat height if necessary. 2. Select an appropriate weight. 3. Grasp the handles or the bar with both hands. 4. Press the handles down until your arms are fully extended. 5. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Smith machine end-grip shoulder press
Desc: The Smith machine end-grip shoulder press is a machine-based exercise targeting the shoulder muscles. It is performed holding the end of the bar in the Smith machine on the outside of the rack. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of an upper-body or shoulder-focused workout.
HowTo: 1. Set the Smith machine bar to the desired height. 2. Adjust the weight on the bar if necessary. 3. Stand or sit under the bar, grasping the ends with both hands. 4. Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended. 5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position and repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Assist machine triceps push-down
Desc: The assist machine triceps push-down is a triceps-focused exercise that is performed on an assisted pull-up or dip station. It is performed by pressing downward on the knee pad of the machine, against the resistance of the weight. It approximates the motion of a triceps cable rope push-down, but with open hands. This variation is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of upper-body or arm-focused training.
HowTo: 1. Adjust the assisted pull-up/dip machine to your height. 2. Select an appropriate weight. 3. Position yourself on the knee pad with your hands on the handles. 4. Press down on the knee pad, engaging your triceps, until your arms are fully extended. 5. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Smith machine close-grip bench press-
Desc: The Smith machine close-grip bench press is a machine-based movement targeting the chest and triceps. The Smith machine mimics a barbell but provides more stability. This movement can be programmed in low reps for strength or higher reps for muscle and strength endurance. It is often performed for moderate to high reps, such as 8-12 reps per set or more, as part of a chest, arms, or upper-body focused workout.
HowTo: 1. Set the Smith machine bar to the desired height. 2. Adjust the weight on the bar if necessary. 3. Lie on a bench under the bar, grasping it with a close grip. 4. Lower the bar to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. 5. Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended. 6. Repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Machine Triceps Extension - Gethin Variation
Desc: The machine triceps extension is an isolation exercise targeting the tricep muscles.
HowTo: 1. Sit on the machine and adjust the seat height if necessary. 2. Select an appropriate weight. 3. Grasp the handles or the bar with both hands. 4. Press the handles down until your arms are fully extended. 5. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for 8-12 reps.

Title: Overhead Machine Triceps Extension - Gethin Variation
Desc: The machine triceps extension is an isolation exercise targeting the tricep muscles.
HowTo: To perform the overhead machine triceps extension, adjust the seat height so that your arms are at shoulder level. Grip the handles and extend your arms overhead while keeping your elbows close to your head. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position and repeat.

Title: 30 Arms Machine Triceps Dip
Desc: The 30 Arms Machine Triceps Dip is an effective exercise designed to target the triceps muscles. This machine allows for a controlled movement, making it easier to focus on the triceps while minimizing strain on the shoulders. To perform the exercise, adjust the seat height, grip the handles, and lower your body by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.
HowTo: To perform the 30 Arms Machine Triceps Dip, adjust the seat height so that your arms are at the correct level. Grip the handles firmly, lower your body by bending your elbows while keeping your torso upright, then push back up to the starting position.

Title: Triceps dip
Desc: The triceps dip is a bodyweight exercise performed on parallel bars or on a pull-up and dip station. It targets the triceps first, but also stretches and strengthens the chest and shoulders. Dips with a triceps focus are usually performed with an upright torso, the knees bent and crossed, and the arms close to the body. Dips can be performed for low reps for strength or higher reps for muscle growth.
HowTo: To perform a triceps dip, position yourself on parallel bars with your arms straight and your body suspended. Lower your body by bending your elbows while keeping your torso upright and your knees bent and crossed. Push back up to the starting position.

Title: Weighted bench dip
Desc: The weighted bench dip is a highly effective exercise for building the triceps. The resistance comes from a combination of body weight and added weight—usually a weight plate.
HowTo: To perform a weighted bench dip, place your hands on the edge of a bench behind you and extend your legs out in front. Lower your body by bending your elbows while keeping your back close to the bench. Push back up to the starting position, adding weight on your lap if desired.

Title: Push-Ups - Close Triceps Position
Desc: The close push-up is an upper-body exercise that targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders. The close hand position places more emphasis on the triceps.
HowTo: To perform close push-ups, start in a plank position with your hands placed close together under your chest. Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides. Push back up to the starting position, focusing on engaging your triceps.

Title: Parallel Bar Dip
Desc: The triceps dip is a bodyweight exercise performed on parallel bars or on a pull-up and dip station. It targets the triceps first, but also stretches and strengthens the chest and shoulders. Dips with a triceps focus are usually performed with an upright torso, the knees bent and crossed, and the arms close to the body. Dips can be performed for low reps for strength or higher reps for muscle growth.
HowTo: To perform a parallel bar dip, grip the bars and lift your body off the ground. Lower your body by bending your elbows while keeping your torso upright and your knees bent. Push back up to the starting position.

Title: Ring dip
Desc: The ring dip is an upper-body strength exercise performed on gymnastic rings. It targets the muscles of the chest, triceps, and shoulders, but is also quite taxing to the core. It is generally considered to be more difficult than dips performed on parallel bars. It is common in gymnastics training and CrossFit workouts, but is also a simple way to make dips more challenging for any strength athlete.
HowTo: To perform a ring dip, grasp the rings and lift your body off the ground. Lower your body by bending your elbows while maintaining control of the rings. Push back up to the starting position, engaging your chest, triceps, and core.

Title: Feet-elevated bench dip
Desc: The feet-elevated bench dip is a popular bodyweight exercise for building the triceps, chest, and shoulders. Elevating the feet brings more chest and shoulder into the movement, but also allows for extra weight on the hips. If these bother your shoulders, try performing them between two benches or chairs rather than on a single bench.
HowTo: To perform a feet-elevated bench dip, place your hands on a bench behind you and elevate your feet on another bench. Lower your body by bending your elbows while keeping your back close to the bench. Push back up to the starting position, ensuring your shoulders are comfortable.

Title: Bodyweight triceps press
Desc: The bodyweight triceps press is an arm movement that involves performing overhead presses in a face-down position on a Smith machine or other raised bar. It is a surprisingly difficult movement that hammers all three heads of the triceps and the difficulty can easily be scaled up or down by moving the bar.
HowTo: Position yourself face down on a Smith machine or raised bar. Grip the bar with both hands and perform an overhead press by extending your arms upward, engaging your triceps throughout the movement. Adjust the height of the bar to scale the difficulty.

Title: Standing Towel Triceps Extension
Desc: Stand upright holding a towel with both hands, arms extended overhead. Slowly pull the towel down behind your head, bending your elbows to engage your triceps. Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position.
HowTo: Stand upright with a towel held in both hands and arms extended overhead. Slowly pull the towel down behind your head by bending your elbows, engaging your triceps. Hold the position for a moment, then return to the starting position.

Title: Tricep Side Stretch
Desc: Stand or sit comfortably. Raise one arm overhead and bend the elbow, bringing your hand down behind your neck. Use the opposite hand to gently push the elbow for a deeper stretch. Hold and switch sides.
HowTo: Stand or sit comfortably. Raise one arm overhead and bend the elbow, bringing your hand down behind your neck. Use the opposite hand to gently push the elbow for a deeper stretch. Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then switch sides.

Title: Triceps Stretch
Desc: Stand tall and raise both arms overhead. Bend one elbow and reach down your back, using the opposite hand to gently pull the elbow for a deeper stretch. Hold and switch sides.
HowTo: Stand tall and raise both arms overhead. Bend one elbow and reach down your back, using the opposite hand to gently pull the elbow for a deeper stretch. Hold the position for a few seconds, then switch sides.

Title: Overhead Triceps
Desc: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a dumbbell or weight with both hands above your head, arms extended. Lower the weight behind your head by bending your elbows, then raise it back to the starting position, engaging your triceps.
HowTo: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a dumbbell or weight with both hands above your head, arms fully extended. Lower the weight behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms close to your head. Raise the weight back to the starting position, engaging your triceps throughout.

Title: Russian Bar Dip
Desc: The Russian dip is a chest-and-triceps building exercise that resembles the chest dip, albeit with a twist that makes it even harder and more taxing.
HowTo: Position yourself on the dip bars with your arms extended and your body lowered. Lower your body by bending your elbows while leaning slightly forward, then push back up to the starting position, focusing on engaging your chest and triceps.

Title: Straight-arm plank with kick-back
Desc: The straight-arm plank with kick-back is a hybrid movement that trains the abdominal and triceps muscles simultaneously. It can address multiple muscle groups in a time-efficient muscle-building or circuit-style workout, while also providing an additional cardiovascular challenge.
HowTo: Start in a straight-arm plank position with your body in a straight line from head to heels. While maintaining the plank, lift one arm and extend it back into a kick-back motion, engaging your triceps. Alternate arms while keeping your core tight.

Title: TBS Dip
Desc: The triceps dip is a machine version of an exercise that many lifters perform using parallel bars or two parallel benches. The machine is found in many gyms.
HowTo: Sit on the dip machine and adjust the seat height if necessary. Grip the handles and lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground. Push back up to the starting position, focusing on using your triceps.

Title: Bench Dips - Gethin Variation
Desc: The bench dip is a highly effective exercise for building the triceps. The resistance comes from the body itself, rather than weight.
HowTo: To perform the Bench Dips - Gethin Variation, sit on the edge of a bench with your hands beside you, fingers facing forward. Slide your hips off the bench and lower your body by bending your elbows until they reach a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position, focusing on engaging your triceps.

Title: Banded dip
Desc: The banded dip is a bodyweight exercise targeting the chest, triceps, and shoulders. This variation utilizes an exercise band to help support the lifter in the bottom part of the movement. This makes pushing out of the hole easier, and may combat the shoulder pain that some lifters feel when they perform dips. The top of the movement receives less help from the band, putting more stress on the triceps.
HowTo: To perform the Banded Dip, attach an exercise band to a sturdy anchor above you. Place the band around your shoulders and grasp the dip bars or edge of a bench. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms are at a 90-degree angle, then push back up to the starting position. The band will assist you in the bottom part of the movement.

Title: Bench Dip - Gethin Variation
Desc: The bench dip is a highly effective exercise for building the triceps. The resistance comes from the body itself, rather than weight.
HowTo: To perform the Bench Dip - Gethin Variation, sit on the edge of a bench with your hands beside you, fingers facing forward. Slide your hips off the bench and lower your body by bending your elbows until they reach a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position, focusing on engaging your triceps.

Title: HM Chair Dip
Desc: The HM Chair Dip is an exercise that targets the triceps, shoulders, and chest. To perform this exercise, position yourself in front of a sturdy chair or bench, place your hands on the edge with fingers facing forward, and lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms are at about a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position.
HowTo: To perform the HM Chair Dip, position yourself in front of a sturdy chair or bench. Place your hands on the edge with fingers facing forward. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms are at about a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position.

Title: Bench dip
Desc: The bench dip is a highly effective exercise for building the triceps. The resistance comes from the body itself, rather than added weight.
HowTo: To perform the Bench Dip, sit on the edge of a bench with your hands beside you, fingers facing forward. Slide your hips off the bench and lower your body by bending your elbows until they reach a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position, focusing on your triceps.

Title: Holman Step Triceps Dip
Desc: The Holman Step Triceps Dip is a variation of the triceps dip that incorporates a step for added elevation. Begin by placing your hands on the edge of a step or bench, with your feet elevated on another step or surface. Lower your body by bending your elbows, then push back up to engage the triceps.
HowTo: To perform the Holman Step Triceps Dip, place your hands on the edge of a step or bench with your feet elevated on another step or surface. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms are at a 90-degree angle, then push back up to engage your triceps.

Title: Holman Chair Triceps Dip
Desc: The Holman Chair Triceps Dip focuses on building strength in the triceps. Sit on the edge of a chair with your hands beside you, fingers facing forward. Slide your hips off the chair and lower your body by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.
HowTo: To perform the Holman Chair Triceps Dip, sit on the edge of a chair with your hands beside you, fingers facing forward. Slide your hips off the chair and lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms are at a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position.

Title: Bodyweight Triceps Rope Press
Desc: The Bodyweight Triceps Rope Press is an exercise that targets the triceps using a rope attachment on a cable machine. Stand facing the machine, grasp the rope with both hands, and press down while keeping your elbows close to your body. This movement effectively isolates the triceps for strength development.
HowTo: To perform the Bodyweight Triceps Rope Press, stand facing a cable machine with a rope attachment. Grasp the rope with both hands and press down while keeping your elbows close to your body. Focus on isolating your triceps as you press down.

Title: Holman Heavy Triceps Overhead Press
Desc: The Holman Heavy Triceps Overhead Press is an effective exercise for targeting the triceps muscles. To perform this exercise, stand or sit with a barbell or dumbbells held overhead. Lower the weights behind your head while keeping your elbows close to your ears, then press back up to the starting position.
HowTo: Stand or sit with a barbell or dumbbells held overhead. Lower the weights behind your head while keeping your elbows close to your ears, then press back up to the starting position.

Title: Holman Couch Triceps Dip
Desc: The Holman Couch Triceps Dip is a bodyweight exercise that focuses on the triceps. To perform this exercise, sit on the edge of a couch or bench with your hands beside you. Slide off the edge and lower your body by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.
HowTo: Sit on the edge of a couch or bench with your hands beside you. Slide off the edge and lower your body by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.

Title: FYR2 Triceps Push-Up
Desc: The FYR2 Triceps Push-Up is a variation of the standard push-up that emphasizes the triceps. Start in a push-up position with your hands close together. Lower your body while keeping your elbows tucked in, then push back up to the starting position.
HowTo: Start in a push-up position with your hands close together. Lower your body while keeping your elbows tucked in, then push back up to the starting position.

Title: 30 Arms Triceps Dip
Desc: The 30 Arms Triceps Dip is a challenging exercise that targets the triceps. Use parallel bars or a sturdy surface to perform the dip. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground, then push back up.
HowTo: Use parallel bars or a sturdy surface to perform the dip. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground, then push back up.

Title: 30 Arms Close-Grip Push-Up
Desc: The 30 Arms Close-Grip Push-Up is a variation of the push-up that focuses on the triceps. Place your hands close together on the ground and perform a push-up, keeping your elbows close to your body throughout the movement.
HowTo: Place your hands close together on the ground and perform a push-up, keeping your elbows close to your body throughout the movement.

Title: 30 Arms BFR Close-Grip Push-Up
Desc: The 30 Arms BFR Close-Grip Push-Up incorporates blood flow restriction (BFR) training. Perform a close-grip push-up while using BFR bands on your upper arms to enhance muscle growth and endurance.
HowTo: Perform a close-grip push-up while using BFR bands on your upper arms to enhance muscle growth and endurance.

Title: Supine Chest Throw
Desc: The Supine Chest Throw is an explosive exercise that targets the chest and triceps. Lie on your back with a medicine ball or weighted object. Throw the ball upward as you sit up, then catch it as you return to the starting position.
HowTo: Lie on your back with a medicine ball or weighted object. Throw the ball upward as you sit up, then catch it as you return to the starting position.

Title: Decline EZ-bar skullcrusher
Desc: The decline EZ-bar skullcrusher is a popular exercise targeting the triceps muscles. The angle of the bench creates a greater range of motion than flat bench skullcrushers, as well as targeting the lateral head of the muscle. This exercise is usually performed for moderate to high reps as part of an upper-body or arm-focused workout.
HowTo: Lie on a decline bench and hold an EZ-bar above your head with arms extended. Lower the bar towards your forehead by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position.

Title: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher
Desc: The EZ-bar skullcrusher is a popular exercise targeting the triceps muscles. The EZ-bar is used more often than a straight bar. As for the name, that’s worst-case scenario. The bar should actually come down behind the head. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps as part of an upper body or arms-focused workout. No need to chase a 1RM on this move!
HowTo: Lie on a bench and hold an EZ-bar with an overhand grip. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on squeezing the triceps.

Title: EZ-bar skullcrusher-
Desc: The EZ-bar skullcrusher is a popular exercise targeting the triceps muscles. Contrary to what the name implies, the bar should actually come down behind the head. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps as part of an upper-body or arms-focused workout.
HowTo: Lie on a bench and hold an EZ-bar with an overhand grip. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on squeezing the triceps.

Title: Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Press To Chin
Desc: The Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Press To Chin is an effective exercise for targeting the triceps. Lie on a bench with a barbell held above your chest using a close grip. Lower the barbell towards your chin while keeping your elbows tucked in, then press back up to the starting position.
HowTo: Lie on a bench with a barbell held above your chest using a close grip. Lower the barbell towards your chin while keeping your elbows tucked in, then press back up to the starting position.

The bar should actually come down behind the head. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps as part of an upper body or arms-focused workout. No need to chase a 1RM on this move!

The bar should actually come down behind the head. It is usually performed for moderate to high reps as part of an upper body or arms-focused workout. No need to chase a 1RM on this move!
HowTo: Lie on a bench and hold an EZ-bar with an overhand grip. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on squeezing the triceps.

Title: 30 Arms EZ-Bar Skullcrusher
Desc: The 30 Arms EZ-Bar Skullcrusher is a great exercise for isolating the triceps. Lie on a bench and hold an EZ-bar with an overhand grip. Lower the bar towards your forehead by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on squeezing the triceps.
